Reviews.Title: Great value for an underwater camera!
Reviews.Author: Eric Slay
Reviews.Content: It's a great time to be in the market for underwater cameras. Because so many people have good cell phone cameras, camera manufacturers have had to step up their game and offer point-and-shoots with more functionality than the phones that everybody already has in their pockets. Underwater/shock-proof/dust-proof/freeze-proof cameras are for those times when we're having fun in environments that would typically ruin a regular camera or phone.Here's what I like about this camera in general:1. You can take it in the pool. Last summer, some of my best shots were of my kids underwater in our swimming pool. We have so many great memories of our pool, but until we got an underwater camera, we didn't have these captured. Another thing that we've really enjoyed is the ability to take video underwater. For fun, I get in the pool, have the kids dive in and then swim up to me while I video the whole thing. There's something really amazing about starting a video above the water with all the sound and water reflections and then going under when they break through the water and hear the muted underwater sounds as they swim up to me. More importantly, the smiles on their faces are bigger/more authentic than when we're just standing in the back yard and I ask them to smile.2. You can bring it to the beach and just throw it in the sand. When my kids are at the beach, we like to build huge sand castles. In the past I have brought my non-sandproof camera and spent most of the time a)protecting the camera from flying sand; and b)getting angry with my kids for flinging the sand in the direction of the camera. Now, I actually get in the line-of-fire as they're digging because the flying sand in the foreground makes for some great pictures.To sum it up, the best camera for the job is always the one you have with you. If you're scared your camera is going to get wet, sandy, or freeze, you'll leave it at home where it won't do you any good. With this Fujifilm FinePix XP60, you'll have *no worries*---As far as this type of rugged camera goes, I have owned Canons, Nikons, and Olymupus' offerings. Currently, my favorite of all is the Olympus TG-1iHS 12 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom  (you can see my review there as well) (*also note there is also a new model for this, which is here: Olympus Stylus TG-2 iHS Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom and 3-Inch LCD (Red))This Fuji proudly sits in second place in my opinion. That being said, it is also nearly $200 less than my beloved Olympus, so it is definitely a great value.Here's some specifics:The camera is built well. It's sturdy and has a solid feel. BUT, the biggest selling point for it's build-quality may be it's biggest problem for some: it's pretty small - like the size of two iPhones pressed together. This is great because you can just throw it in your pocket or purse and it won't take up much room. The problem this presents is that the buttons on it are pretty small, which will mean you might press the wrong buttons once in a while, especially when using it underwater. I'm an average size guy and it didn't offer me too much trouble, but if you're larger-than-average, you might want to look elsewhere.The photo quality is great. The pictures look good in and out of the water. Because I only use it for messy, sandy, watery situations, I can't report on how good it does indoors or in extreme low-light situations.There are a ton of features, and many of them are useful. In fact, it shares many of the features with the Fujifilm X20 Silver 12 Digital Camera with 2.8-Inch LCD (Silver). If you check my review there, you'll see that I love:SR is an advance auto mode that determines the best settings based on the scene. It even shows its predictions, so you can see if it is accurately assessing the situation. From my experience, it's startlingly accurate. It chooses from: landscape, night, tripod, beach, sunset, snow, sky, greenery, and sky & greenery. Having these settings on a camera is old news, but having the camera predict the scene itself and do so with great accuracy is a pretty exciting advancement.Also, there is a NATURAL setting which I love. What it does is takes one picture with flash and one without continuously and then let's you decide later which worked best in the situtation. Being a pro photographer, I am usually pretty good at choosing, but this is really helpful to my wife. Let me give you an example: If you're taking pictures in a darkened room of your child blowing out their birthday candles, your camera is going to choose flash to lighten things up. The problem with this is that it kills all the beautiful candle light. Using the natural-mode on the camera will give you both. It's actually a great learning tool.As far as video quality goes, this camera does a great job with that as well. Don't expect it to look like and HD movie you've rented from Nexflix, but you can expect it to capture great detail that your phone just can't see.--In conclusion, I think this is an excellent choice for a rugged underwater camera. Buying this (or another model) to capture the fun you have this summer is a no-brainer. The pictures you get will be priceless before you know it....If you found this review helpful, let me know! If there are any questions you'd like answered, I'll do my best to help. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix XP60 16 MP Digital Camera / MUST READ ! !
Reviews.Author: partyoffive
Reviews.Content: After doing plenty of research on underwater cameras at this price level. I came to the conclusion that this is the best camera for the price.  PEOPLE,..its an underwater camera,..not a $400 SLR professional camera. ITS best pics are outside and underwater. Expect good pictures at night with the flash at about 10ft of distance,..nothing more. But if I wanted this,..I would not have been using an underwater camera..... HELLO ???My galaxy S3 phone takes great HD pics and video so I am comparing this review using my phone and the camera. I have an underwater case for my phone and the pics and video are truly HD and awesome. So this little camera had its work cut out for it since I bought it. I thought there would be now way that it could come close to my phone pics and video. I was wrong !PICTURES: Great high resolution pics even with an 8GB class 4 SDHC card, above and under the water. Love the fact you can take video and shoot pics at the same time. Screen brightness blows my phone away. I can barely see my phone under direct sunlight, but this camera has great brightness and can easily be seen under direct sunlight. Love the burst shot mode ! !VIDEOS...........VERY IMPORTANT......YOU NEED A CLASS 10 SD CARD TO RECORD HD 1080I VIDEOS. I bought my camera as a bundle at COSTCO which brought me the 8GB SDHC card CLASS 4. DO NOT USE THIS CARD FOR YOUR VIDEOS. A CLASS 4 CARD DOES NOT SUPPORT 1080I VIDEO WELL. IT WILL RECORD IT BUT THE QUALITY WILL REALLY LACK. TRUST ME.  I have tried it with both the class 4 and the class 10 cards. Also,..I did research on these cards. The class 10 records perfect 1080i video like my galaxy S3. Some people don't know this and notice that their videos are not great. Its not the camera,..its the card !So many features that I have yet to learn on this camera. This camera does some things that my Nikon L820 doesn't do. The floating strap is a must if your planning to take it in the ocean. It holds the camera and does not let it sink. Over all. I definitely recommend this camera. I do strongly suggest you buy an external battery charger on ebay or amazon so that you can charge your battery outside the camera. While charging the battery you have to use the provided USB charge cable which means you have to open the battery door and leave it dangling while the battery charges in the camera. This leaves the battery door at somewhat of a dangerous open position and subject to breaking. Overall, this camera does what its supposed to do. Period !

Reviews.Title: Great camera. With Limitations.
Reviews.Author: Otaku Guru
Reviews.Content: I have a problem. I buy cameras like every year to every other year. I do have valid reasons for upgrading. Trying to find the perfect camera for the use. For me, this is my cruising camera. I needed something that can go deeper. That I can use on a boss excursions (think a scooter and sub combined), snorkling, and free diving while under water. I need an underwater camera that can take great underwater pictures and video and not have it look all green or blurry. I needed something with an optical zoom rather than digital only. I got this little baby on ebay for $140 with case, underwater strap, and a 8gb sd card. For the price I paid it is worth it. This camera is neat, but there are some minor flaws as well as pluses. I still think you can do better on underwater cameras, but even the nikon aw100 that is similar priced has nearly the same flaws. I think it has more to do with limitations with it being an underwater camera and the glass they use.This camera is waterproof. It goes down to 20 feet. Although their are cameras that go deeper, why spend $300 on one. Even the ones that go 30-36 feet are not universal. I almost bought one since I like to scuba dive, but that's rare and only on select cruises since I am not certified. Scuba diving you will go 30-60 feet underwater with a discover class. If you go deeper than 30 feet you risk your camera. Why get a $300 camera when it may not even work for basic scuba diving. I know the depth varies on where you go, but it helped know that the $300 still may not be able to go that deep for scuba. Boss you go down about 12 feet and this camera can easily do that. It is about 8 feet to the top of the helmet. I haven't tested this camera in deep water. Just the bath tub. It stayed sealed and the pictures were pretty good for underwater, but that's not a great test. I know from the videos on youtube with the xp50 the underwater pictures and video are superb. They rank right next to $300 underwater cameras. For me, this is an underwater and on water use camera only.This camera has some great pictures modes like 3d, panorama, selective color, underwater, landscape, etc. The auto in general is great, but you will need to go to picture mode underwater for the best under water pics. I talked with fuji about that since I was going to try staying in auto on trips.One thing I like about this camera is like my slr, you can snap pictures while recording video. Great for family functions. Just know you will hear clicks on the video from the shutter.I have a caribbean cruise coming in March. I wanted to use this on the trip exclusively since most of the excursions are on or around water. Problem is, the picture quality is somewhat lacking. Not awful. When you zoom in on the pictures they get fuzzy really quick. The picture quality zoomed in is the worst I've seen on any of my recent cameras in the past 5 years. The good news is this is a 16mp camera so unless you are making a movie size poster, when will stretch it past 100%? I messed with settings and if you lower the picture quality to 12mp or 14mp the picture quality greatly improves. You still get big pictures, but zooming in they look better by shrinking them slightly. I guess the sensor they used is not ready for prime time. Or better yet, maybe a firmware update will fix it. Within the settings you want to change your pictures to "fine" instead of the default standard. It gives a little more detail. Because of the picture quality, I'm going to use my budget pocket point and shoot. That way my slr is safe on the waves and only break out the xp60 for in the water pictures. Also, because of the picture quality issue, make sure you zoom in while taking pictures rather than trying to edit them on your computer. That way you get the best pictures. I'm not saying the pictures are that bad. Without being resized they look great. Let's say you want an 8x10. That is shrinking the image by a good half. When you shrink down the image while printing you get just as good if not better picture quality. For most people that's great. Just if you don't plan ahead on what you will print and use something like photoshop to zoom in you start to see a bit a blurring at around 120%. Unless you use photoshop or need to blow up a small 1/8th chuck of your photo you will never have a problem. This camera doesn't do great in low light. It loses a lot of detail. Avoid using at night in the house or when there's not a lot of light in the room. Outdoors it is great though.This is a really snappy camera and fun to use. Underwater this camera is the bomb. I love how the latch clicks into place and you should be sealed against water. Just watch the strap doesn't keep the door unlocked. Be careful handing this to others while in water. That latch looks like a camera knob and the last thing you want is someone popping out your battery under water and frying the camera. The latch has to be turned and the middle button pushed in to unlock it, so it does make it harder to accidently open the camera. For kids, this is a great and versatile camera. However, if you are cruising you are better off using a point and shoot as much as you can and using this camera where it is risky like around water. Even a nice underwater camera like from Nikon has image quality issues when zoomed in. I think it has a lot to do with the glass they use to protect the lenses. For 95% of the people out there you won't blow up the images before you print. With it being able to handle 16mp or even with my recommended 14mp to address picture quality issues you have more than enough mp to print what you need. In the end this is the best budget underwater camera I've found. Awesome snorkeling pictures and video. Land pictures are very good, but know you are limited in zoom.Personally, I would only recommend this camera for kids that need a camera that can take a beating or using this around extreme outdoors. For general indoor and sight seeing by land you want to keep your existing camera that probably has better zoom, better in low light, and hopefully better picture quality when blown up on the computer.

Reviews.Title: Leaked on vacation
Reviews.Author: ts
Reviews.Content: Ordered camera for a trip to Mexico. Received a few days before and used to photograph some of the flooding here in CO (in the rain), and on a quick hiking trip in the mountains (dry). Was happy with the picture quality. To get clear/well lit photos just play with the pre-set modes until you've learned what is best for different situations. On the trip I was generally happy with the photo quality- the LCD screen was hard to see underwater, and it had a hard time in low lit situations, but overall good enough considering how much fun it was to use it on the beach.  The camera seemed to be doing fine and I was meticulously following the instructions in the manual after every ocean or pool use (rinsing, soaking, drying, etc). However, on day 3 of my vacation I took it snorkeling. When I came out, it would not turn on. I rinsed, dried, etc. when i got back to my room. The lens, LCD screen, and flash all fogged up. I let it dry according to directions. Nothing. Even when returning to dry, not-humid CO the camera never would dry out/work again or charge. Very disappointing as i was only halfway through my trip. If you plan on using this in the rain, want something that can survive an accidental dunking, or wade on the beach (but not swim) this camera would probably be fine. If you plan on submerging it I would not recommend. Returned mine yesterday and will look at other brands.

Reviews.Title: Considering the price I'm very happy.
Reviews.Author: J. Donaldson "Cal-diver"
Reviews.Content: August 22, 2013 UpdateWe are having a lot of fun with the XP60. We take it on the boat, to the beach, in the spa, and the local city pool. It's just great to put the floating wrist strap on my, or my grandson's, wrist and snap away when we feel the desire. I don't have to worry about bumping it, or getting it wet.As long as I keep the camera locked on ISO 100 we do get some decent photos. I also have taken some reasonable video. This one is jerky because I was driving a jet ski with one hand and taking the video with my left hand. [...]June 18, 2013 UpdateWe've now used this little camera extensively since it arrived. We've taken perhaps 500 photos with it. Here are my recent observations.The photo quality is not the best and the camera sometimes makes poor exposure decisions. Many photos come out of focus. Some of this is operator error, especially the focus issues. There is quite a lag between pushing the shutter button and the photo being captured so it is easy to push the button then lower the camera before the shot is capturee. Even with the ISO fixed at 100 the image quality isn't really great.I would say about 95% of the photos are properly exposed, and 75% are in focus.All of these comments must be taken in the context that I am a photo enthusiast and I usually am using a $650 camera body with an $850 lens. With that camera rarely is a shot out of focus and almost never improperly exposed. Of course the image quality from the DSLR is exceptional. The DSLR also has near zero shutter delay.On the other hand...I really like that this camera is hardy and waterproof. For the first time I was able to take a camera on the tow tube and take photos of the boat from there. It is so nice to hand the camera to anyone and ask them to take shots or video. I'm quite at ease having it move from place to place on the boat and not worry that it is going to get damaged.One of the big benefits is my three-year-old grandson likes using it and I'm happy to let him. 98% of his shots are trash but the other 2% are worthy of posting. As someone on Facebook said they are finally able to see me in photos.I no longer have to worry about using my iPod Touch on the boat, or don't have to bring the expensive DSLR along on the boat either.In the right conditions the camera does spit out some good photos, most are worthy of posting online which is my main use for photos most times. Videos are not bad either.Would I recommend this camera? Yes with the understanding that it is inexpensive and the waterproof feature is the biggest benefit.I have two other inexpensive (but more expensive than the XP60) and I spent some time comparing the image quality of those two cameras against the XP60.Sony W50 6MP camera (not waterproof) images were of lower quality than this XP60. This made me feel like I'd made the correct decision because with a waterproof housing the Sony W50 has been my on water camera for several years.Sone w150 8.1MP camera (not waterproof) images were almost identical to the XP60.Original ReviewI have a consumer level DSLR for great photos. I needed something for the boat/jet ski. I'm not always comfortable with the DSLR on the boat. This one fills the bill.I have to put all of my comments in the context that this camera costs about 1/10th the price of my DSLR. Obviously there is no way the photo quality, low light capability, or sharpness can match an expensive DSLR with a great lens. But for a waterproof point-n-shoot under $200 this is a pretty good camera.Pros:- Small and pocketable- Rugged to 5 foot drop, I can hand this one to my 3-year-old grandson.- Waterproof to 20 feet.- 5X zoom, one of the main things that attracted me to this camera.- Pretty good image quality for outdoor shots (considering it is an inexpensive point-n-shoot)- Zoom during video - there are many cameras on the market that can't do this trick- Auto focus during video - there are many cameras on the market, including a whole bunch of very expensive DSLRs that can't do this.- Quiet zoom so you don't hear it on the videos- Take snapshots during video - very cool feature that I wish was available on my DSLR.- Good menu system- Dedicated video button- 10 frames per second (up to 10 max)- 1080i video at 60 frames per second- Totally internal zoom. Nothing protrudes from the camera body.- Can use the camera while it is plugged into AC or another power source. (I have an external USB battery pack that can charge/power the camera)- Too many other features to mention in detail here here. I mean really, face detection, several movie modes, several shooting modes, numerous scene modes (sports, low light, HDR, portrait, landscape, filters, panorama, night, and more), Auto ISO ranges, various image sizes, white balance options, continuous shooting, shutter volume, exposure compensation, self timer, etc.- The front glass that covers the lens resists water droplets. Very cool.- AF illuminator to focus in the dark.- Uses a standard USB cable to charge.- The AF Illuminator lamp doubles as a charge lamp.- Micro HDMI connector- Printed help manual included- CD full help manual includedCons:- Some grain even at 100 ISO but outdoor shots don't show it until you crop 100%- More grain than you'd like at higher ISO- Not so good low light capability- Wrist strap slide/keeper slides too easily- Battery can be inserted backwards - dumb design fault.- No viewfinder. I said I wouldn't buy a camera without a viewfinder but this was just too good and cheap to pass up. I still think it needs a viewfinder for bright sunlight situations.- Snapshots during video are not the best quality- I wish the lens was in the middle of the face of the camera. It's too easy to get fingers in the photos (much like my iPod Touch)- No smile shutter option, but I've never used that feature on my other cameras anyway.- The "standard" USB cable is a type with a very small connector on the camera end. None of the dozens of USB cables I already have would fit.- No external battery charger supplied but for this price I didn't expect one. I ordered the $19.99 Wasabi Power charger with 2 extra batteries on Amazon.- Clunky manual 3D images - but I don't care because I'm not a 3D proponent.I will post a few photos I took today.I did take the camera into the spa this afternoon. I didn't let it stay underwater too long because I was afraid it might overheat. It worked great in both single photo mode and in video mode. It was great to play with the camera, look it over, and check all the menu options, without worrying that it was getting wet. I won't be using this at 20' depths but it will certainly get wet on our boat or jet ski.I did not buy this camera from Amazon, my favorite store, it was on sale elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy a Fujifilm Camera!
Reviews.Author: Lloy A. Keeling
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Fujifilm X60 and used it three times before it failed.  The camera was not abused, dropped, or.used underwater.  It simply stopped working and would not turn on.  I returned the camera to Fujifilm per their instructions and was surprised and dismayed to receive an invoice for $117.00 to repair what they termed an out-of warranty problem, stating that the HDMI pins were bent.  I HAD NOT connected this camera to an HDMI cable!  How the pins became "bent" is a mystery to me.  I emailed the details to customer service with no response other than a message to say the email was received.  I then called the repair department and asked to speak to a supervisor and was transferred to voice mail.  After leaving two messages, I received NO response at all.  This has to be the poorest customer service I have ever experienced.  No reputable company should treat their customers with such disrespect.  Needless to say, I will not purchase from Fujifilm again.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, Terrible Support
Reviews.Author: Steven M Cygan
Reviews.Content: I got this on sale for $150 and at that price you really can't beat the number of features in a waterproof camera.  My main problem is that the HDMI port wouldn't accept a cable (I verified the cable works on other ports), it looked like there was an extra piece of metal or something in there.For some reason I actually paid attention to the bundled notice to send it in for repair rather than just returning it.  They informed me that my warranty was void because of damage to the USB port.  First of all, the USB port works just fine, short of pouring glue in it, I wouldn't know how to damage it even if I wanted to.  After arguing with their customer support several times about why they were refusing to fix a defect (this was not damage, it was present from the moment I opened the box), I finally gave up and returned it.  It seems clear to me that the repair technicians are instructed to find any possible reason to avoid honoring the warranty.

Reviews.Title: Value Camera Performer
Reviews.Author: W. L. Holder
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera.  It is durable, waterproof to shallow depths, and takes excellent photos.The photos are excellent, particularly with the image stabilization.  Unlike so many others, you can actually zoom in on a subject without camera shake ruining most of the photos.  The burst mode works well too, though it takes a while to save afterward.  The panaramic option in burst is really cool, allowing you to easily take panaramic shots by sweeping accross a landscape while in burst mode.The video quality is surprisingly excellent as well, particularly the sound.  This camera could easily replace a mid-level camcorder for most uses.There is an option to sysc the camera to directly upload to your preferred social media, though I admit not trying this out as I have no desire to do upload photos that way.The camera is waterproof to 20 feet, which would be great for swimming pools and basic snorkeling, though I wouldnt recommend for SCUBA as that depth is too easily passed.  I have tested this in the pool and the river, it takes great photos and stays completely waterproof.Fujifilm claims the camera is shockproof to 5 feet, though I did not feel compelled to drop it from 5 feet to test this.  Ill take their word on it and report back if my kids ever knock it off the counter or something.Overall, this is an amazing camera for the price.  To top it off, it even comes with a "real" memory card so you dont have to immediately run out and buy a bigger one.

Reviews.Title: Broke my 2nd one, already
Reviews.Author: Michael P. Furey "Michael Furey"
Reviews.Content: I've just killed my 2nd example of this Fuji camera in three years.  The first one died after I dropped it on the kitchen floor.  I expect breakage from a regular camera, but this one claims to be shock proof.  So, I bought another one because it took good pictures, especially underwater in the pool and at the beach.  The second Fuji is on its second summer but it's on borrowed time.  The view screen permanently shows a huge black hole in the lower right corner.  If I jump into the pool with my kids with the camera strapped to my wrist, the screen shows pink and green horizontal lines and will not take a picture. I have to take out the battery and memory card and let the camera spend a day sitting in the sun to dry out.  I don't think I'm terribly abusive to this camera but it just doesn't seem to hold up to my expectations of a camera intended to be part of an active, outdoor lifestyle.  As soon as I find another sale at Target, Amazon or Costco for the Olympus TG-630 (regular price is $180 and sale price is $120) I'll try the Olympus because it gets much better reviews.

Reviews.Title: Not great but not bad either
Reviews.Author: Happy r/c
Reviews.Content: PROS:- I went diving in Florida up to 20 feet underwater and it did stayed dry thanks to the awesome dial that you have to turn to close the door tightly.- Good underwater photos- 9 out of 10 high def videos played back fine on my pc.- The floating strap- I was not afraid to bring it with me to the beach in sand and saltwater.- Amazing 5X optical zoom in a little camera, although when I was underwater, taking shots at 5X zoom was very difficult to get the subject in the screen so I mostly shot zoomed out.  The Amazing 5X optical zoom was better used for when I was standing on the beach and shooting.CONS:- Video is saved in Quicktime .MOV format so when I tried to stream it from my pc with TVersity software to my Microsoft XBOX, it would not play.- When I played the video on my pc, one of the 10 videos played back in slow motion even though I did not do that.- Kind of weird that both photos and movies are saved in the photo folder on the memory card instead of separate folders (photo and video) like my SONY and PANASONIC cameras.SUMMARY:I would prefer the videos in AVCHD format like my SONY and PANSONIC cameras.  In the meantime, to stream from my pc using TVersity software, I'll have to convert Quicktime to AVCHD format using Sony Vegas Movie Studio HD.6/25 update: I installed a different codec for TVersity and now the Quicktime format plays (but it looks horrible like the days of standard analog tv) but my other zillion movies in AVCHD format stopped working. I guess I have to keep searching for a codec that plays all formats.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Captain Jim
Reviews.Content: This camera did everything it said it would for about 2 months. Now it won't take a charge, even with a brand new battery. I have tried everything but it still won't turn on, nothing lights up. I'll never buy another Fujifilm camera again.

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality, poor LCD display, rest is fine
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at Best Buy and returned it after a week.In users' reviews, when you read "It does great pictures", "great high resolution pics", "great photos and videos", remember that's very subjective. I worked in a photo lab, and I had many customers telling me that the quality of the pictures from their single-use camera was great. But it was not, not great compared to the picture you'd get from an average camera. But people were happy with them.For this camera and any other cameras, do a bit a research and google for reviews on specialized sites. You'll see some sample pictures. For the XP60, picture quality is poor, really. There is a lot of noise, even at ISO 100 and pictures are really lacking of details. Yes, it may not bother you when looking at a screen resolution, but you'll notice on prints, and if you crop the picture.[update]  I uploaded a customer image for this product showing a crop at 100% zoom: http://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-media/permalink/mo2WXJBWOTHMDHO/B00ATM1M92Do yourself a favor and compare the picture quality of the XP60 with other cameras. For instance google "ephotozine xp60" and you can see full size test images.The other big issue is the quality of the display. The resolution is significantly lower than other cameras. In 2013 a 2.7-inch LCD display with a resolution 230k dots is definitely a big disadvantages versus the competitors. Viewing angle is pretty bad as well. This means that underwater depending on the conditions, you can't really see what you're shooting. You need to be just in front of the display, if you're a little above, you won't see correctly the picture, and with the poor resolution, it doesn't help.Apart from these two issues (which for me were the reason why I returned it) the camera is nice. It's fast, you can quickly turn it the camera on and take a picture. Some camera have some delay that will make you miss pictures. I had no issues with water leaking or other water issues. I believe that Fuji have now a lot of experience in underwater cameras and if you're operating it correctly you won't have issues using it underwater.The video mode is nice (although I'm not the right person to judge video quality). An issue I found with Video is as soon as you zoom a little, it struggles a lot to find the focus.You you need to know about these two issues (picture quality and LCD quality) before making your choice. If that's not an issue for you that's a great camera. But for me picture quality is the most important thing about a camera, that's the reason why I put only two stars.For the same price range, have a look at the Olympus TG-620 Tough iHS Waterproof Digital Camera (Blue) with Case and Float Strap. Picture quality is night and day, the display is 3 inch and 460k dots. It's 12 megapixels. Believe it or not, on small cameras like this, it's better to have 12M than 16M because the sensor has more light sensibility and on these cameras, the real resolution bottleneck is the lens.Other options is looking at older version of the Fuji XP, cheaper, with less megapixels and better picture quality (especially the noise). You can get a GPS version for the same price (if it's useful for you).

Reviews.Title: Junk Camera
Reviews.Author: Jefferson Bagley
Reviews.Content: Camera died after only 5 months. Fujifilm refused to honor warranty. I will never buy a Fujifilm product again. Olympus cameras last forever!

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: Book Guy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to compliment my Cannon SLR. Let me just say my SLR has me spoiled and this thing is not even in the same league as my $700 SLR, but that's ok.  I bought this because I wanted to take pictures in situations where using my SLR could be dangerous (rain, pool, beach, dirty environments) and wanted a smaller camera that I could fit in my pocket easily.  Having gone through multiple digital cameras due to water damage, dust, dirt, etc. I decided a waterproof one was needed.First the good, this camera is at home underwater, the pictures it takes are just amazing.  I've take it to the beach and on snorkeling trips and it constantly surprises me with the quality of the pictures.  It also takes really good pictures in daylight and/or in bright conditions it can almost match the quality I see in my SLR pics in these conditions.Now the bad, throw in shadows or a darker environment and this camera has no clue what to do.  Turning on face tracking seems to make it better but it doesn't fix it entirely.  I don't think the software in this camera is up to the task of recognizing the environmental conditions and adjusting the hardware accordingly.  Often times when taking pictures in medium to low light conditions I have to pick the scene selection manually and/or switch to plain auto mode to get a decent picture.Video on this camera is ok, I haven't played it on my digital TV yet so I couldn't comment on its quality yet.Overall if you want a tough little outdoor point and shoot, its a good camera.  It is not suited to all conditions and I wouldn't recommend getting this as your sole camera over a normal point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Rugged, User Friendly, High Resolution, Lousy Zoom
Reviews.Author: Kyle Slayzar
Reviews.Content: I do a lot of photography and video work whether it be making instructional videos for the class I teach online (US Military History) or just enjoy seeing what the world has to offer via vacationing.  I have a small fleet of cameras at my disposal including two GoPro Hero 2s, a Canon Vixia, an old Sony Cybershot we won't bring up again, and am thinking about getting a Canon DSLR for more professional shots albeit my skills being anything but.The only other thing I do not have is a single-shot ruggedized camera.  While I have my GoPros, I use them almost exclusively for mounting shots on anything that does not require an operator such as vehicles, helmets, and, in one instance, mounting them on the rifles of ND Guardsman.  I needed something for quick, single-shots on the go in environments that I wouldn't risk expensive cameras on, hence the need for something a little more ruggedized.When I had the opportunity to review the Fujifilm XP60, I already had some tasks in mind to try it out and, so far after almost a month of testing, it's still operating in new condition.The first test I put it through was working in the rain.  During the last month, here in Bismarck ND, it has been raining a LOT more than usual with the occasional thunderstorm.  I also have a North American Robin's Nest recently built above my home's gas fireplace exhaust.  Upon receiving the camera, the mother Robin had just laid her eggs and this gave me the perfect opportunity to track the progress of the nest from the laying of the eggs to birth, adolescence, and eventual departure from the nest.  In the rain, and sometimes the thunderstorms, I ventured outside, kept a safe distance from the nest as to not disturb the mother, lifted the camera above my head to get the lens at the perfect angle, and took shots of the nest.I am happy to say that I got some amazing pictures of the baby Robins from birth to their leaving the nest last week (after an unfortunate misunderstanding when my mother came over to see them and ignored my warnings to keep a few yards back and got dive-bombed), and the XP60 is still in great working condition.  To explain just how rainy it was, at one point we were under a severe thunderstorm warning and, despite that, I was out taking pictures of the mother Robin keeping the babies warm and, while I was soaking wet necessitating several beach towels be utilized to dry me off, the camera was equally soaked but remained operable.To test the picture quality I then had the pictures professionally printed (don't have a printer yet, at least, not a good one worthy of 16 mexapixel) and sent to my room mate's parents, who requested them during their stay here last month.  Even on 8 1/2 x 11 glossy prints none of us could tell a reasonable difference between mine and those of a 35mm print.The XP60 sports 16 megapixels and that is amazing, especially for those of us who thought 4.6 megapixels were amazing back in 2001 and had not bought a digital camera since 2008 (the evil Sony Cybershot that I still have).  I am not a professional photographer despite having some field experience (IE: filming US Army field training, mountain climbing, hiking on non-designated trails, etc.) so I cannot comment on the image quality of the XP60 versus say a higher end DSLR (which, I'm trying to get into) but I was deeply impressed with the overall picture quality of the XP60.  My family certainly appreciated the glossy prints of the Robin's nest I took and my Grandma is considering rendering them into watercolor format in her studio as she is a professional painter.However, even with the rugged durability and the fantastic picture quality, what really impressed me was the user-friendly interface.One test that I always employ to measure how user-friendly anything is that I hand them to the least technologically savvy person I know and have them conduct tasks with them without ANY instruction to see how long it takes them to figure it out.  Fortunately, as stated earlier, my room mate's parents were in town and, to illustrate their level of techophobia, his mother was still rocking a 14 year-old Nokia 3310 cellphone that was lauded for having "rare" features like the game Snake and a working calculator.  I remember having to explain what iTunes was ("An evil program that will crush your soul but do it efficiently.").  My room mate did not have a digital camera and asked to borrow my new XP60 so I tossed his mother the camera and asked her to turn it on and take a picture of me, then promptly delete it not to test her but because I'm as photogenic as Julia Robert's ex-husband.To my surprise, she was able to complete the task within two minutes.  Her biggest obstacle was finding the review button, but that took all of 30 seconds as she simply utilized Holmesian deduction in deducting what buttons were NOT the review button.  The button interface is easy enough to figure out and so is the actual software interface.  Imagine what we users could do if we utilized the nerd mantra of "RTFM" ("Read The Flippin' Manual!")!!My only complaint about the XP60 is the lacking zoom lens.  While it's 5x optical zoom is slightly larger than the industry average of 2-3x, it still makes the XP60 little more than an in-your-face or right-in-front camera.  However, after reading my comments on the XP60, it isn't designed for such medium to longer-range endeavors; it's an everyday camera intended for outdoor durability.  It's a summer camera designed for your average, everyday American, whose only camera experience ranges from children's parties to that summer road trip that turns out to be anything but enjoyable ("Are we there yet?").The XP60 will make a great addition to my fleet of cameras, especially as I prep for an anime convention this month in Minneapolis and will hand it off to my partner, who only takes pictures with his iPhone 4.  Oh, the horror!

Reviews.Title: Does not work.  Fujifilm does not stand behind this camera
Reviews.Author: regularperson
Reviews.Content: The Finepix took poor pictures.  But we tolerated that for the waterproof/shockproof features.  Then it completely stopped working and we sought warranty coverage.  Other reviewers described this issue -  Fujifilm claimed "the customer damaged HDMI pins.  Damage not covered under warranty."  Fujifilm said that to us as well.  I explained we had never used the HDMI.  Fujifilm said the consumer must have accidentally used the USB in the HDMI port and damaged the pins.  I said I had looked before we sent it and the HDMI pins were fine.  Fujifilm said "we used a microscope and could see damage that caused the pin to short circuit the entire board".  A microscope to disallow damage on a shockproof camera?  Fujifilm knows there is a problem with this camera, but its policy is to refuse to honor the warranty.  Fujifilm partially admits there is a problem because they will offer to send you a new camera with an extra batter at 1/2 price ($60).  If the consumer is fully at fault, then why offer such a steep discount?  Instead I will use that money to buy a good camera from and honest company.  If you buy the finepix, do not expect good pictures, do not expect the camera to work for long and do not expect Fujifilm to honor the warranty.

Reviews.Title: Sporty, waterproof, and shockproof camera.
Reviews.Author: D. Chou "THE Savvy Consumer"
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoy the great outdoors so we were glad to try out this Fujifilm FinePix XP60.  What we've noticed after using it a few weeks:Likes:>Waterproof to 20ft/6m.  Perfect for pictures/videos at the beach, by the river, or in the pool.>Shockproof at 5ft/1.5m.  Prevents permanent damage from minor mishaps.>Nice 2.7" LCD screen for shooting and viewing pictures/videos.>Easy to start up: insert the battery and SDHC memory card into the waterproof compartment, charge it, and it's ready to roll!>Simple set up: turn on camera, set language and time, and start shooting pictures or videos.  Additional cameras settings are simple using the easy to navigate menu.>No worries about taking pictures in the rain or accidentally dropping it in a shallow fountain or pool.>Freeze proof to 14°F/-10°C for our trips to Alaska and Northern Canada.>5x optical zoom and 10x digital zoom to capture faraway scenery.>High Speed Burst Mode for taking pictures in rapid succession (9 fps) to freeze/capture action scenes at the exact moment that I want.>Advanced filter modes for different colors/effects.>Advanced 3D viewer and static picture mode that allows 3D picture printing by Fujifilm.  (Will try that feature soon).>Handy, optional Surf Camera Case provides hands free operation when swimming, shallow snorkeling, surfing, paddle boarding, and boogie boarding, etc.>We've gotten at least five hours of use when only taking static pictures.  Battery life shortens noticeably when taking HD videos (1920x1080 @ 60fps) at the highest resolutions to about two to three hours (a much larger memory card will be needed).>We use the intelligent SR (Scene Recognition) Auto mode that lets the camera automatically select the optimal settings for easy point and shoot.Slight Dislikes:>Printed manual only covers the basics.  One needs to use the owner's manual on the FinePix CD to learn about the more advanced features.>No carrying case.  We had to purchase a neoprene waterproof case separately.>Shockproof rubber borders mainly around the LCD so that still leave some plastic case edges vulnerable to damage.>Very short USB-micro USB charging/data cable: only 23".  Awkward when charging or transferring data.>Wall adapter only for the charging cable.  No battery wall charger included.>*NO SDHC memory card included in standard retail version!*. Fujifilm was kind enough to provide reviewers with a 4GB SDHC card, enough memory only for taking static pictures or very short duration/low res. videos.  We've immediately upgraded to a 32GB SDHC for taking more pics and videos.>LCD screen is still susceptible to scratches like all cameras so I applied a more water resistant clear screen protector that will stay in place.>Similar to most waterproof sports cameras by design, this XP60 doesn't have an automatic lens cover so the large front camera lens is susceptible to fingerprints, dusts, debris, and scratches.  *Camera lens must be cleaned off frequently for clear, bright pictures!*>Construction, materials (mostly plastic and rubberized plastic required for most waterproof cameras), and tactile feedback of the buttons don't feel as high quality as my Canon Powershots (mostly metal/alloy).>Pictures and videos are very nice and sharp but the colors somehow don't seem as "natural" as my Canon Powershot cameras.  Most likely because we've been using Canon cameras for many years.  Strictly subjective.Overall:A sporty, versatile, waterproof, and shockproof camera with all the latest camera technologies and features that should fulfill the needs of most consumers especially adventurous travelers who enjoy water sports.  Long term durability and water/shock resistance remains to be seen.

Reviews.Title: Underwater Fun
Reviews.Author: Evan Jacobs
Reviews.Content: OK, I received this camera and was excited to try it out.  After installing the battery and charging it I found that the camera wouldn't turn on.  Nothing.  Very odd.  After some investigation I discovered that, unlike just about every other digital camera I've ever owned, you CAN install the battery upside down.  This means nothing works, of course.  This is a profound design error but once I flipped the battery around, all was well.  The camera is more stylish than my Panasonic Lumix TS4 Waterproof Digital Camera although it's slightly larger.  I much prefer the locking mechanism for Fuji's battery door.  The specs on the Panasonic's waterproof and shockproof are about double the Fuji but neither is really suitable to scuba anyway.  The Fuji picture quality is excellent and there's a burst mode that is very cool.  The Panasonic's lens goes just a touch wider than the Fuji but not enough to make a difference.If you enjoy time around water, the beach, river, swimming pools, etc this is a great camera to have.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: jody h young
Reviews.Content: Bought camera for a trip to Florida. Used it for snorkeling, swimming with dolphins, and just goofing around in the pool. Pics turned out clear. Just what I was hoping for!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: annahull
Reviews.Content: Used this camera for underwater shots during snorkeling in Bahamas. Really is waterproof and no problems. Very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Shock proof??? Not really...
Reviews.Author: Renato A Martins
Reviews.Content: Got this camera as a gift for my mom, since she had a stroke and sometimes let's things fall from her hand. Unfortunately, didn't buy it from Amazon, but instead, from a physical Target store. First few days of use, she is sitting side-by-side with a friend, and hands over the camera to her friend. It slips from her hand and falls on the floor (it was not even 2 feet-high, they were sitting!!!). Result, camera doesn't work anymore, gives a "zoom error" or a similar message, and won't focus anything.Ah, right, and couldn't even test its underwater resistance.As I don't live in US, the camera is not covered on the warranty here... In summary, burned 160 bucks...Certainly won't go for Fuji cameras again. I've read good reviews on the shock/waterproof Panasonic Lumix. Will give it a try.

Reviews.Title: One of the worst customer service and repair department doing business today!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jorge
Reviews.Content: I copied this review from another person because is exactly what happen to me. Their customer service department is one of the worst I have ever dealt with. I left 6 phone messages for the manager and he did not return any. Beware if anything goes wrong with the camera Fuji Repair will try to get you to paid for it. This is the review: " The Finepix took poor pictures. But we tolerated that for the waterproof/shockproof features. Then it completely stopped working and we sought warranty coverage. Other reviewers described this issue - Fujifilm claimed "the customer damaged HDMI pins. Damage not covered under warranty." Fujifilm said that to us as well. I explained we had never used the HDMI. Fujifilm said the consumer must have accidentally used the USB in the HDMI port and damaged the pins. I said I had looked before we sent it and the HDMI pins were fine. Fujifilm said "we used a microscope and could see damage that caused the pin to short circuit the entire board". A microscope to disallow damage on a shockproof camera? Fujifilm knows there is a problem with this camera, but its policy is to refuse to honor the warranty. Fujifilm partially admits there is a problem because they will offer to send you a new camera with an extra batter at 1/2 price ($60). If the consumer is fully at fault, then why offer such a steep discount? Instead I will use that money to buy a good camera from and honest company. If you buy the finepix, do not expect good pictures, do not expect the camera to work for long and do not expect Fujifilm to honor the warranty".

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera! Do not buy!
Reviews.Author: fiala
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible camera! The pictures were never clear from the start. We took this as the primary camera on a cruise. It worked (kind of) on the first few days. On the third island we went snorkeling. Halfway through our snorkeling, the camera started recording video on it's own and then flipping through menus continuously. I tried taking out the battery and putting it back in, but that did not help. Water did not get in the battery And SD compartment, but it was leaking out of the buttons on the camera. We tried leaving the camera out and open for 24 hours, but that did not help either. I was not able to take the pictures on the last half of my cruise because of this camera. I'm very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: John T
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Tromans
Reviews.Content: I had the same experience as did Mr Richard Fan.  Camera failed in the third use and when I sent it back to Fuji they claimed that I damaged the HDMI port.  I have never used this port!  That must be Fuji's standard ploy to avoid warranty repairs.  I took about 80 pictures and that comes out to $2 a picture.  This camera is not worth the box it comes in.  I will never buy a Fuji product again.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I ever had!!!!
Reviews.Author: Felipe Antonio Amaya, M. D.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera so much that I have put a nail on the wall & keep looking @ it often to make sure that it hasn't walked.  I was accidentally introduced to the ruggedness & power of this camera as I was taking pictures from my bathroom window on a second floor of my cousin on the first floor.  Somehow I lost my grip & this camera fell.  I was distraught as my two day old camera had just dropped from the second floor.  I rushed down stairs and to my surprised, my camera was totally functional, including the flash, & it didn't even have a scratch on its paint coat.The next day I went & bought another one.  Now I am happy with two.The quality of the pictures is just amazing & the flexibility to alter them to your taste will leave you extremely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: depends on your needs
Reviews.Author: C. Walker
Reviews.Content: If you want a camera that is SPECIFICALLY for outdoor use, this is a great choice. If you need a camera to take on your mountain biking trip or while surfing, this tough and inexpensive camera is what you want.But that toughness comes at the price of photo quality. Indoor shots are very disappointing. This camera does not focus well indoors without the flash on, even in extremely large, light rooms. And the flash is harsh and washes colors out. To get a halfway decent indoors photo you have to fuss with the manual settings far longer than a small child is willing to sit still.Get this camera if you're going on an adventure trip. But don't expect great photos on Christmas morning in the living room.

Reviews.Title: SO so
Reviews.Author: dave smith
Reviews.Content: My phone takes better pics and is much faster and always in my pocket....however I like the waterproof and shockproof idea....should have come with a memory card

Reviews.Title: Poor HD movie format.
Reviews.Author: Nevermore
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably good camera for the money in many ways, it unfortunately has one glaring technical oversight. The HD movies this camera creates instead of being in a normal 1080p/30 format are in a 1080i/60 format! For the most part interlaced movie formats have been obsolete for years. What this means is that if you wish to use these movies for anything other than basic playback where most media players will automatically de-interlace the format, then you will have to convert them using software such as handbrake to a standard format first. This is a time consuming tedious step which should be completely unnecessary. If you forget to do this first, then despite what's your project looks like on your screen while playing, you'll find that when you export it to the final product it becomes a complete mess of interlaced lines. It's too bad, because in most other ways this camera has performed admirably for the price point and I would have given it four stars. However a bizarre and incompatible movie format is simply unacceptable at this point in camera development.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: T. Wortham
Reviews.Content: After comparing this with the XP170 (with wi-fi), I decided on this camera because of the photo options ( 12 options vs 4 option on the XP170).  I bought it for my son and we used it on a recent trip and it took great pictures.  I had my Canon Rebel on the trip also but rarely took it out of the case, as this one was so convenient to use.  I didn't want to take my Canon to the beach so this one went with us and we didn't worry about it getting sand or water on it.  My son tested the underwater capabilities and the pictures were good and there were no leaks.  Overall, it's a good camera for the options and the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Reliable Underwater Performance
Reviews.Author: J. Perkins
Reviews.Content: Instead of repeating the specs aptly described by other reviewers and the product description above, I will focus on my general experience with this camera and a few features that stood out to me.  Overall, I think this is a great camera.  I have bought several different digital cameras recently for family members (Sony Cybershot, Kodak EasyShare), even another rugged underwater camera for my young son (a Panasonic Lumix TS20).  This camera certainly compares favorably with all of them.The camera takes great quality photos.  It has a multitude of features and modes.  The menu is easy to navigate, easier than other digital cameras that I've had.  In particular, I used the burst mode to catch the kids in action or at least the exact moment when they are both looking at the camera and smiling at the same time and not distracted or fighting with each other.  Natural and With Flash Mode is useful too, taking 2 photos one after another, one with and one without flash, so you can select the best result in any particular situation.Video recording works great.  It operates using a separate, dedicated button so you don't have to go into the menu.  So you can take a photo, then push a button to record a short video, push the video button again to stop recording, and go right back to taking pictures.  I used this to great effect at my daughter's last softball game to take some still shots, and then get some videos of her at-bat and running the bases.A couple of modes that I played around with, but did not get good or expected results were the panorama and 3D mode.  With 3D mode, to be honest, I have no idea what I was doing or getting with that mode.  It probably is just me.  With panorama mode, you get the option of 120, 180, or 360 degrees.  On vacation at the beach I experimented with this mode, but even using 120 and 180 I could not get an accurate panoramic photo of the length of the beach.Can you actually use this camera underwater and get decent results?  Yes.  To prepare the camera for underwater use, simply check the seals on the battery door to make sure they are clean and in good shape.  Select the underwater shooting mode, and you are ready to shoot.  Within an hour of using underwater, rinse the camera off under running water or soak in a bowl of water for 10 minutes, then dry it off with a towel and let air dry for a little while.I actually was so pleased with the normal everyday performance of this camera that I really did not want to risk using it underwater in case it did not perform well and was damaged.  Fortunately, there have been no problems or leaks when used underwater.  We have used it twice at pools to take underwater photos with the kids, which was a lot of fun.  Overall, I am very pleased with this camera so far and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great for camping!
Reviews.Author: STybring
Reviews.Content: Took it canoeing and camping for a long weekend and it was great. I took an extra battery just in case but did not need it. No performance issues whatsoever and the features were fun! I upgraded my memory card and it took very fast shots

Reviews.Title: Are you kidding me?!
Reviews.Author: Ramon Lopez
Reviews.Content: I bought this little gem for my family's vacation to St. John's in the Virgin Islands mainly because I wanted underwater photos while snorkeling with the kids and I didn't want my Sony NEX anywhere near the sand. Well, guess what??? My Sony stayed at the resort and we toted this little camera everywhere-pool, beach, ocean....First, let me say that this camera is WELL worth the small investment in terms of capturing an expensive vacation. It took beautiful pics, great underwater photos and video that really surprised me! The photo quality is not perfect, but for less than $200 - you can't go wrong.I bought the camera as a bundle that included a floating wrist strap, so this camera floats if lost at sea (or pool).The video was a bit fast, but the camera withstood mild abuse and diving to about 15 ft....I didn't push it past it's tasted limits.I thought the video was bad when I downloaded directly to my ipad, but it turned out to be Apple's video codec. Downloading to a standard PC proved it worked as advertised.In short - buy this camera without hesitation if you want good underwater photos and video. I gave it 5 stars not for the photo quality alone, but for the entire package. You won't be disappointed :)

Reviews.Title: problem not covered by warranty
Reviews.Author: kristen crouch
Reviews.Content: My daughter received this as a Christmas gift. We wanted something that was water and drop proof.  I don't know of anything happening to it, but within 2 months it wouldn't charge or turn on.  We sent it in only for them to tell us the issue wasn't covered and would cost $100 in labor to fix.  We were very disappointed in the customer service and will not buy another Fuji camera.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater pics!
Reviews.Author: Jess in Cali
Reviews.Content: We took this camera to Belize and used it everywhere from underwater, to the beach, to the jungle.  It held up fabulously on the entire trip.We followed the directions, rinsed it off after use underwater, and had no problems!!Great value for the money :)

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: JAMES NEILL
Reviews.Content: Camera takes excellent pictures. I haven't used it under water but have been using it on the beach in Mexico. You can see the viewfinder in the bright sunlight.  I am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great second camera
Reviews.Author: Charles G Martin
Reviews.Content: I purchased the XP60 as a secondary camera. Of particular interest was the fact that it is water proof ,shock and dust proof. The shock proof part was tested early on. I took a tumble on some ice and the camera dropped out on my pocket. It works just fine. This camera has an amazing amount of features that make prefect for a glove box camera, or for time when you don't want to pack a DLSR.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ryan J
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for an anniversary trip.  Last time we were at a resort we missed a lot of pictures because we didn't have a waterproof camera.  This time we got tons of great pictures by the pool.  Camera turns on fast and takes pictures fast so you don't miss the action.  Love the mode where it takes multiple pictures as long as you keep the button down.  Got some great shots of jumping into the pool.  Very happy with the camera and the quality of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera!
Reviews.Author: A. tan "ALT"
Reviews.Content: Pros:-Underwater (yes tested this in a pool and worked fine)-Stylish looks.-Long Lasting battery.Cons:-Poor image quality even my cellphone takes better pictures.-Bad light balance. It takes too long to balance pictures usually comes out very illuminatedYes I tried everything on the best or finest options and even tried to manually adjust the light settings. For the price I cant complain and would reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: Sb
Reviews.Author: Sb
Reviews.Content: We took the camera to Belize for our two week vacation. I snorkeled multiple times and it took amazing videos and pictures. IMO this camera was worth every penny! I also purchased a 32 gig ultra scandisc. After 600+ photos and more than an hours worth of snorkeling videos the camera was still taking perfect pictures!

Reviews.Title: Good Value Camera!
Reviews.Author: Masayuki Shimizu
Reviews.Content: I use this camera for mainly taking pictures at beaches or underwater. I have a canon DSLR and Sony point & shoot for regular uses. The picture quality might be not as good as my canon or sony for standard uses. I do not recommend this product for your main camera. As a waterproof/shockproof camera, this camera is great value. You can take nice pictures or videos underwater. Few minor complains are that there is a fair amount of time lag between when you push the shutter button and when the camera actually capture the image. I see a fish in the center of LCD and press a shutter button. The fish is often out of flame in captured images, or you capture the tail of fish in the image. Also, the shutter speed is not fast that some images of fast moving fishes come blurry. I think you need good practice before you can take good underwater images.

Reviews.Title: Great features but phone like picture quality, often out of focus
Reviews.Author: Skelshy
Reviews.Content: We got this because previous camera failed and we wanted one we could take to the beach without having to worry about sand and splashes. Taking it snorkeling was a big bonus.Starts up fast, pretty communicative, on screen help and such. Usually focuses fast. We liked all the colors it comes in. Panorama mode, HDR, image stabilization, the works. Inexpensive for the features.After a day at the beach, we had trouble opening the battery compartment because sand had gotten into the locking mechanism. Fortunately we had a safety pin at hand to clear out the sand otherwise we'd been unable to charge the battery.Pictures were really disappointing, low contrast, dull colors, often slightly blurry. It's about as good as the better phones. The closest camera to compare is the one we had three cameras ago, a $100 Canon A series. That Canon took much better pictures, even with a cheap third party waterproof housing. Currently our other camera is an S90. The S90 of course takes better pictures, but it also costs twice as much. Let's be realistic - a waterproof camera is a compromise. Moving parts (zoom) have to be internal and you probably only get a plastic, flat front lens. What's expected is a camera that reliably takes pictures for Facebook use where we can't take other cameras. Because, hey, if you have no camera with you because you are afraid it might get damaged, you get no pictures at all.In this light, this camera doesn't quite do the trick. Even for Facebook use, the pictures are very soft and visibly washed out. Taking pictures under water, a lot of shots were missed because the camera would not focus at all. when it did, most were a grey-brown blur. I realize underwater photography is tricky, and results can be mixed. But we've simply seen much better results from other cameras. My wife, who isn't a pixel peeper at all, didn't like the camera either and decided to return it.There is no orientation sensor, this means you can't upload pictures directly, you have to sort through them and manually rotate. Other cameras do this automatically, and it can be a substantial time-sink.

Reviews.Title: Ho Hum
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Murphy
Reviews.Content: I used the camera for the first time last weekend.  I have no idea what I did from picture to picture, but one picture will look fantastic and the next picture (taken 2 minutes later) will look blurred.  These point and shoot camera's are pretty easy to use and I'm well-aware of how the focus works.  That's not the problem.  The problem is that picture quality is inconsistent.Perhaps I'll find some dum-dum mode that makes it all work all the time, but I'm a little disappointed.  It should come pre-set in dum-dum mode.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE: Proprietary USB cable
Reviews.Author: E. Hoffman
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for my birthday and though I haven't tested it thoroughly yet, I'm giving it a review of 2 stars because it uses a proprietary USB cable.  It doesn't appear you can buy this cable from Fuji.  There are 3rd party "compatible" cables for sale on Amazon, and Fuji makes a standalone battery charger (model BC-45W), but as it ships you're stuck with just the cable.  I have lots of Micro USB and Mini USB cables around my house so it's really frustrating when companies make products that don't adhere to the standards.  One of the selling points for this camera was the price, but if it ends up requiring the purchase of a $30 battery charger it negates that somewhat.For what it's worth, the interface seems easy to use.  The pictures quality looks OK, but I mostly wanted this for an upcoming vacation so I can take underwater pics.  When that happens I'll update the review.

Reviews.Title: GREAT camera
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: Don't let the small size of this camera fool you!!  Very easy to use.  I ordered this camera because I was going on a cruise and had planned a lot of water activities that I knew I would want photos of. It worked GREAT!!!! Even with the picture size set at medium the photos I took in and out of the water look amazing!! The colors are vivid and bright, true to what I was looking at when I took the photo.  I was a bit concerned that outside in the bright sun I would not be able to see what I was taking a photo of.  But that was for nothing, I could see the display even in the bright Bahama  sunshine. Bottom line, I was definitely not disappointed with this camera and the wide range of things you can do with it.  Video, panoramic photos, continuous shoot mode, underwater, taking of 2 shots of the same thing with and without flash, the zoom is amazing! The shock proof seems good, I did drop it off my counter top onto a tile floor, and it also fell out of my pocket and hit a rock on a golf course and no problems with any of the functions.It's light weight and easy to put in your pocket or small purse. I went to a local store and purchased camera straps I could put around my neck, and even carrying for several hours there was no strain on my neck.  I am now considering selling my other big name larger camera and making this my primary go everywhere camera!!!!

Reviews.Title: Fuji Waterproof - ahhh, nothing special if you don't mind a three year life maximum
Reviews.Author: Capeman
Reviews.Content: I 've owned two of these and it seems that once I was  in the third year as an owner/user, like clock work they failed.  It just won't power on, It has a charge on the battery but N/G.  I did use the camera for under water photos as well as in & out door photos.  I was satisfied with all the photos.  They were clear and in focus.  So if you don't mind the three year life span than this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: impressive capabilities but....
Reviews.Author: david dannhauser
Reviews.Content: Really an amazing camera for the price. A vast range of customization available to achieve outstanding pics in every conceivable condition in a user friendly interface.  Sadly however out of the box the HDMI port was not working and now has been returned for repairs. Camera was a factory refurb but one would still expect all functions to be tested.

Reviews.Title: Takes great videos when it works
Reviews.Author: Eric J. Oswald "I drink your milkshake..."
Reviews.Content: I bought this for taking underwater videos. The videos it took were great. The quality of still images was just ok.I followed the directions and never had the camera more than about 5 feet underwater. After using it a few times it made a terrible buzzing sound and stopped working. Is sent it to Fuji to be fixed (they made me pay the shipping). They sent it back saying it was fixed but it wasn't. It seems its a bad battery (which they didn't replace). I have talked to them 3 times now over the last month. They promised each time they were sending a battery. Just found out today they forgot to send it.I will never buy a fuji camera again.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Scott Coffelt
Reviews.Content: Camera is good for outdoor pictures, but not as good for indoors and did not take clear underwater pictures in ocean.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Susan T.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera.  I am so impressed with all the functions that this camera is capable of. And it is water proof. Love it.

Reviews.Title: weak on portraits
Reviews.Author: whtwtr17 "p.diablo"
Reviews.Content: Clearly not the a primary design of this camera, but I was still hoping for better.  Otherwise I'm pretty happy.

Reviews.Title: working camera battery sucks
Reviews.Author: Tiquanetta
Reviews.Content: Camera is working fine but battery completely charged once and won't charge again. Will need to buy another battery. Wouldn't charge while we were on vacation so we could only take pictures on our phones the rest of the vacation.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Lisa Anne Beck
Reviews.Content: We needed a waterproof camera to take on a cruise. After lots of research, I decided to get the Fujifilm FinePix XP60. We took it out on snorkeling adventures and were very pleased with the ease of use and picture quality. Highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pictures
Reviews.Author: M. Schutz "MN Kindle"
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting much from this camera because it was so reasonably priced.  I was so happy with my purchase, I have recommended this camera to 4 other people.  It took great pictures underwater as well as out of the water.  My only minor complaint would be that sometimes it was hard to see the display screen under water, but it certainly did not bother me too much.  This camera is a great value and I plan on taking it on every vacation.

Reviews.Title: love, love it
Reviews.Author: L.Licker
Reviews.Content: I've already used it snorkeling, in the rain, everyday use, and on the beach. The different filters are great and give files larger than my DSLR. Since there is no camera lens I did have to get a case to protect it from scratches. That's the only downside. Had one been made for it then I'd say it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great waterproof camera!
Reviews.Author: LM
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband as a birthday gift before our trip to Hawaii and he loved it!  It is easy to use and it takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Amanda stinson
Reviews.Content: Great camera I am very happy with it. Take amazing quality pictures. And I love the under water modes. And fast moving picture modes

Reviews.Title: Great for surfing!
Reviews.Author: Jen K.
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome! I take it with me when I surf, and so far it has performed beautifully. Even underwater shots are quite good. I'll be doing some trips to the springs here in Florida, where the water is super clear, so I am excited to see how the pictures will turn out. One tip, I wear Seaspecs when I surf which have polarized lenses, and that makes the LCD screen a little harder to see. Otherwise this camera is great for all things int and around the water. Also, you need to buy a memory card, because it doesn't come with one. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Jana  Levitov
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my Caribbean vacation. I love that I didn't have to worry about my camera getting wet/destroyed. I took it snorkeling, zip lining, to a waterfall, jet skiing, and kayaking. The out of the water shots were very crisp and pretty.  Because the sun wasn't out when we went snorkeling, the underwater shots were just okay (not the camera's fault). The only minor problem I encountered was that I couldn't get the flash to stay on.  I think that if I had played with it more it would have been fine.  For the price and convenience I strongly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Only recreational camera you'll ever need
Reviews.Author: Herbert Estes
Reviews.Content: Wife has the XP50 without the multi-shot option, and I have the XP60. We've been taking these cameras to the reefs of Jamaica and Belize, the results have been awesome. Pictures and video under water turn out great, to include the audio on the videos.

Reviews.Title: Underwater Camera a HIT!!!!
Reviews.Author: Lynne Fabian
Reviews.Content: I had and excellent experience!!!  My 11 year old daughter stated to me that if "Santa" brought her an Underwater Camera, then she would know for sure, there is a Santa (Cuz she knew I could not afford such a gift).  So, only a couple of days before Christmas I looked on Amazon and found what she had requested.  It was in it's packaging, with all attachments (i.e.; charger, usb cord).  It came exactly as the Ad stated on Amazon.  Even though I couldn't afford the extra for overnight mailing, I received the Camera the day before Christmas Eve.  She was so Happy when she saw the camera!!!

Reviews.Title: So much fun!
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my honeymoon cruise. I wanted to take underwater pictures primarily. It has so many functions and options it was so much fun to play with. It took great pictures of sunrises on the sea. Oh yea the zoom is sick! I used the speed function and zoom to get a cool pic of a F-16 fighter jet that was practicing overhead. I'm not savvy when it comes to these gadgets and it was easy to understand and use.

Reviews.Title: FinePix XP60 Waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: krusin
Reviews.Content: This camera is of good quality. It is winter here, so I have yet to try it in or around water yet. Just the right size for a camera and it fits right into a small pocket. Gave it a 5, I have no complaints and the pictures are good quality.

Reviews.Title: loving it
Reviews.Author: William Collins
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures!  I like the clarity in the pictures.  I like all the capabilities like its HD function.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera!
Reviews.Author: SRF10
Reviews.Content: I have not taken this camera underwater yet (or dropped it...not looking forward to that feature) but it takes great pictures and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Love Home Alone
Reviews.Content: This camera takes wonderful pictures both in and out of water.  I was pleasantly surprised at how good the pictures came out from my trip to Hawaii.  I also "practiced" with it in our pool... and the underwater pictures are so good that I had one blown up to a 16x20 canvas print of my 4 year when she jumped in the pool and was completely underwater!

Reviews.Title: works great so far
Reviews.Author: yukon 2004
Reviews.Content: took with me to guam where we have spent plenty of time in the ocean, and in waterfalls and rivers.  so far so good.  no leaks or issues, just follow the directions provided and everything works fine.  takes great photos, has many options.  love the panoramic option great shots of cliffs and WW2 landing sites.  would not hesitate to tell my mother to buy it.

Reviews.Title: great camera so far
Reviews.Author: Rudy
Reviews.Content: I used the xp60 on a trip to the beach. We took pictures in the ocean and in the pool. The pictures are great. We've had no issues so far. I took video as well and the film looks amazing. I recommend this camera as a first time user of underwater cameras. I was very careful with it though and kept it above water as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Pikemon "QueenofEmbroidery"
Reviews.Content: I haven't used it underwater yet but I am impressed by all the specialty camera settings available.  It even has 5 built-in filters.  The pictures are crisp and clear.  I do wish that it had come with a more detailed user manual.  I'm going to look for one to download.  I do have questions about how to use the 3D and panoramic features.  All in all, I am not sorry that I purchased this camera.  It's small and of good quality.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: W P Bailey
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera! Bought this camera for a 7 day cycling vacation with my family.  It survived a 3' drop, rain, mud & sweat! Great panoramic feature and a dozen or more features. All you need to do is turn it on, point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: I absolutely love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I wanted a high MP camera that was waterproof and drop proof. This camera delivers all that and more. It is awesome and I look forward to using it all the time.

Reviews.Title: Right Red and Ready!
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: Really wanted this camera in red and unavailable in most stores in red.  I look forward to using this for multiple family events and documenting our belongings.  This has all the features that I want without being a difficult to use camera.

Reviews.Title: Simple, Elegant Ready for Use
Reviews.Author: Alper Orus
Reviews.Content: I won't write a long review here. I already own a Digital SLR camera and wanted to buy a small, compact, ruggidized camera for outdoors. I've decided on XP60 and it was ready to use. I've just opened the box and started to use it. It is simple enough for my wife, nice photo capture with auto selection and smart mode.I advice this camera to people who wants a secondary camera for outdoors and everyday family pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: Mr. Bey
