Reviews.Content: This camera is definitely intended to be used in rugged conditions. As far as its use as a touristy camera, the camera can be beaten by many of the market. However, if you're looking for a camera that can handle underwater clearly, you'll be impressed with this Fujifilm camera.I like this camera's ability to quickly snap pictures underwater. If you're going to go snorkeling, you'll appreciate this camera's ability to capture what see you before it swims away. It's also the kind of camera that can take a beating if you bring it out on the trail. The camera is also very easy to charge and hold its battery quite well.The 5x zoom is a bit of an inconvenience if you're exploring in an area that doesn't let you get right up close and personal. The camera makes up for it a bit with the HD quality video, which is more impressive than many. The data is also easy to transfer over to your computer.This camera won't serve as the end all be all of cameras, but it has many effective uses. I've enjoyed using it underwater. If that's what you're looking for, you'll be in luck.

Reviews.Title: Xp50 is a thousand times better than xp60!
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: The older model is so much better than the xp60! Xp-60 can don't be used for indoor shots like the older model can. All indoor shots turn out with a red tint since the xp-60 has a recall defect on the flash timing ( flash goes off after the pic is taken.

Reviews.Title: camera looks cool...but horrible pictures
Reviews.Author: howard l.
Reviews.Content: Great looking outer design (small and well built), but, according to most pro reviews, the XP60 has the lowest photo quality of all the current weatherproof cameras...and I agree.  For that matter, it has lower photo quality than cameras from a decade ago.Even in the "auto" modes, colors are over-saturated, sunny/outdoor shots are too contrasty, indoor shots are dark, grainy with fuzzy edges.  I was hoping the specialized manual modes would help in low light shots, at least, but they're still extremely dark and dull (you basically can't avoid flash when indoors, even when well lit).  The macro also sucks on this, etc.Supposedly, most of us monitor viewers/internet photo swappers wouldn't be able to tell the difference between these pics and a better camera...but, no, they're really bad (spent a lot of time in photoshop trying to fix them, to no avail).  Hell, my cheap 14 year old (4 megapixel) Olympus takes sharper, more natural colored pictures than this...too bad it devours batteries and doesn't work when very cold, or I would keep using it.I'm not even going to go into the XP60's weather resistant features, simplicity, etc (which are quite good) since the photo quality already kills it.  I was going to give it 2 stars, but with such bad photos, I don't think this should even be on the market...it's garbage.I've since bought the Olympus TG-630.  It takes exponentially better pictures, plus it's smaller, lighter and less expensive.

Reviews.Title: Great Fun in the Pool
Reviews.Author: Michael Burns "Burnsie13"
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves her new phone.  We purchased a Sure Shot first, but it leaked on the first plunge into the pool  Last night, my daughter and her friend took a load of underwater pictures with her new camera.  Well done.

Reviews.Title: Better Than My Other Water Proof Cameras
Reviews.Author: W. Dietrich "WD"
Reviews.Content: My first waterproof camera was a Kodak Play Sport (1st Generation).  It was super easy to use.  For the price of this lower end water proof camera, it had OK video and good photos.  After 2 different vacations in Jamaica it started to seep in water and died. Thankfully the SD card survived.On a snorkeling trip to Belize, I decided to upgrade and purchased a Panasonic Lumix and another Kodak Play Sport HD (2nd generation) for my wife.  The Play Sport took much better video and photos than the Lumix.  The Lumix photos were generally blurry and green.  In the water you are constantly moving with the waves and the Lumix had zero stability, thus the numerous blurry photos.  The Play Sport had better photos but the view screen was so scratched up by the end of the trip.  By the way, the Lumix had OK land photos and the Play Sport was horrible on land with no flash. (Play Sport was great with very bright sunlight land shots.)I upgraded to the Fuji, hoping this will be my last waterproof camera.  When I first played with the camera, it was in the evening hours and the metallic buttons made it difficult to determine what the button was for.  Using it in daytime, I was able to clearly see the pictures/letters on the buttons.  The camera has a pretty good locking mechanism for its battery and memory card slots so there is no fear of accidentally opening the chamber underwater (unlike the Play Sport).The Fuji is equipped with Optical Image Stabilization.  It holds up well to the waves of people jumping in and out of a pool with no burred shots. The HD video is sharp and clear.  There are plenty of options and special effects to choose from, like red eye reduction, timers, continuous shots, panoramic shots, options for moving objects, and even different filters.  There are also options for shooting on the beach, for photographs of sunsets, and low light.  The camera definitely had more bells and whistles than I expect to use, but it is nice to have.The Fuji camera is far superior than the other two cameras I purchased.  This camera quickly replaced my Fuji XF1 as my daily, go to camera.  The reason I gave it only 4 stars was due to the zoom.  I do not believe that the zoom will be powerful enough to get a close up of a fish hiding in coral on a snorkeling trip.  I will be using this camera on my next snorkeling adventure in the fall, so I will be updating this review on how it held up to the open waters.

Reviews.Title: LOVE it!! (But don't forget to buy a SD memory card) update 9/12/13
Reviews.Author: critters
Reviews.Content: I have/had at least 4 Fuji cameras, counting this one, but this one's different! The camera is fast to turn on, fast to take a pic, and fast to fire up the flash. Did I mention it's FAST??!! It takes beautiful pics with a depth of field that is perfect for me.In contrast to the others, this one was supplied with an internal battery charger (2-piece USB charger plug), which I don't prefer. Because of the water resistance, the plugs are inside the battery/card door, and I don't want to leave the door hanging open during charging. For another thing, using my old external chargers from the other cameras lets me have extra batteries charged and ready to go, so this is what I've chosen to do.I have no reason to be dunking this baby, so I'll leave it to other reviewers to tell you about the effectiveness of the water resistance; I'm too fond of it to risk it!!MOST highly recommended!9/12/13 I take tons of pictures now that I'm doing photobooks, and I'm just not satisfied with the flash on this camera. Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't, even when it's pitch black dark. I'm just not satisfied with that aspect of it, and takes a noticeable length of time to focus. I can mostly live with that, but the flash drives me up a wall. Hence, it has lost a star.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy!
Reviews.Author: RiverFun

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2HXHH06YCX1XFcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2HXHH06YCX1XFcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:24 MinsPicture taking: The idea of burst mode is nice, but of the multiple "burst" photos taken at once, only one (and sometimes none) of the pictures were in focus when using the camera's built-in automatic sensor mode. For general one-shot-at-a-time pictures, when using the automatic sensor, wherein it is supposed to figure everything out for you and select appropriate setting in the moment, none of the shots were actually sharp...barely passable in some pictures!Video: This is where the camera is nearly worthless! Took it on its first use to the river to capture family boating fun. I detected no image stabilization whatsoever in the videos taken; they were grainy and out of focus at many times. Even more frustrating was that the camera seemed to change recording speeds during the same video sequence. What I mean is the recording would be at real-time speed, and then appear to have processing difficulty that would eliminate frames (perhaps since it could not process fast enough) and make the video look out of sinc, like it was being recorded with a special effect...virtually never recorded a seamless video without problem.I will be returning to Costco if they will take it back without the packaging which I threw away. I had a very old Kodak that got ruined when splashed at the river...it had maybe one-quarter the supposed processing power as this fuji, but it's videos were twice as good as the dismal stuff resulting from this finepix XP60...I think it's a big miss and cannot recommend at all! See attached video to see how worthless the shooting is with this unit.

Reviews.Title: Fuji won't stand behind poor design
Reviews.Author: carolblue
Reviews.Content: I used my camera at work in a hospital and needed to clean it with wipes after entering every patient room.  Upon walking out of a room, I dropped the camera from waist high.  A piece broke off of the top black plastic, making it unable to be cleaned with wet wipes.Fuji's customer service is refusing to honor the warranty because "we designed this camera to not break when dropped".  DUH.After sending the camera in, I received a $116 repair estimate.  I will NOT spend the $116.  I will buy a Canon or other decent camera with decent customer service.  Then I will spend a couple of hours writing this same review on every site I can find on the internet.

Reviews.Title: A Must Have !!!!!
Reviews.Author: shahid qureshi
Reviews.Content: Takes beautiful pictures, I'm the type who photo shops all my pictures but OMG I didn't have to edit and fix any of the pictures I took from this camera, even the under water, pictures were ,very clear, even the pictures I took in the pool of my son who was splashing water all over the place, yet this camera didn't fail me at all, it was amazing to see every drop of water being captured so perfectly, takes beautiful videos too , even under water, the battery life is really good, its a well built water proof strong camera. I suggest to get the Transcend 32GB 10 memory card with this item, I also purchased the accessory kit and WOW everything that comes in it, is a must have with this camera, this camera is the perfect vacation companion and I can give it a 5 stars because I've just come back from vacation and love my videos/pictures, the price is well worth it for something so good like this. I saw a couple of people with this camera too when I was on holiday, and I also saw many many people who were  looking at my camera at the water park in the water who didn't have this camera but you could tell they wish they had, I owe this camera for my fun filled perfect trip

Reviews.Title: This camera is terrific!!
Reviews.Author: Len Eisenberg
Reviews.Content: I use this camera when I kayak.  I bought it because it was said to be waterproof and sinceI'm on the rivers for hours at a time I thought it would fill the bill..  It has.....in every way.I have dropped it a couple of times in the water with no ill affects whatsoever.  I just keep shootingwith it.Picture quality is excellent whether using the still or movie venues.  And it will do many more thingssuch as editing, that I was surprised with.  I have a much more expensive Nikon camera that doesn'tdo some of the things that this little camera does.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Item is NOT sold new im certain....
Reviews.Author: djginyc
Reviews.Content: Im 100% sure this item is not NEW and may be Refurbished. It came in a box that was not in its Original Fuji packaging with NO user manual or factory warrenty. The picture quality is "O.k" at best and i havent used its waterproof feature yet but im expecting the worst given i failed to read the reviews before i purchased. Im curious as to why it was shipped as it was....

Reviews.Title: Beware Mac Users
Reviews.Author: D. Frohlich
Reviews.Content: Of 3 cameras this is absolutely the worst digital camera I have ever owned.  It has been impossible for even IT experts to recover my photos on either a Mac or PC.  Fujifilm's tech support is also useless. So much for my recent trip to Peru.

Reviews.Title: BUY THIS!
Reviews.Author: Amba2314 "AA"
Reviews.Content: I ran into a guy with this camera at Typhoon Lagoon in Disney World. We had all just snorkeled with sharks and he asked me to take a picture of he and his family. After the pic, he showed me the UNDERWATER HiDef video with AUDIO of their experience and I immediately knew I had to have this camera!! I got it for an amazing price under One fifty and I have taken SO MANY pictures with this camera!!! We went on a 5,000 mile road trip and this camera performed in all situations and climates!! I even took in into the HOT springs in Pagosa Springs, CO and it performed beautifully despite the heat and minerals. Regular pictures are awesome, esp with the setting selected for the 10 shots at a time. Great for motion shots. I am 2000% pleased with this camera, the best I have ever owned. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: Good choice if underwater photography is important
Reviews.Author: Bruckner
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my fiancée to use on a cruise. She found it to be very easy to use and carry around with her. She really liked the flotation wristband while she was snorkeling. She wanted something that would get good pictures, be easy to carry and would work underwater.Looking at the pictures I thought they were good if not great - several times the camera was fooled on its exposure, and since the camera shoots in JPEG only it limits your ability to correct exposures afterwards. She said the camera focused very slowly. Any camera of this type will struggle with underwater photography because of its small lens and the relatively low-light nature of the environment - this camera had a little trouble with blur and focus underwater, but with some practice I think it could be very effective. To get more capability I think you'd have to spend a whole lot more.Overall I think this is a really good camera to carry around as a quick point and shoot with underwater capabilities. If the underwater features aren't important, I'd probably prefer a Canon or Nikon for their better photo quality.This product is or has... Long shutter delay  Poor zoom range/performance  Easily fits in pocket/purse  Long battery life  good choice for underwater amateur  not the best choice unless u want underwater

Reviews.Title: It works well but picture quality is poor.
Reviews.Author: E. Gruss
Reviews.Content: I purchased from another retailer and tested it out in the pool and compared to pics on my Nexus 4 smartphone with an 8mp camera.  I decided to return the camera and will be using a dicapac to take underwater pictures with my phone instead.  My cell phone pictures were just as good as this camera, same level of detail even though this camera had 2X the pixles.Also when trying to take pictures with the sun in the background did not turn out well at all.  It gets lensflare very easily.  The LCD on the camera really adds color to the pictures that I didn't see once they were on the PC.  If you want it just to put pictures online and create some youtube videos with it being able to go underwater and take some hits then the camera should be fine and will work for you.I was hoping to take it instead of the good camera while on vacation, that it would perform better in more situations than my cell phone.  Unfortunately that was not the case.

Reviews.Title: Spontaneous erasure
Reviews.Author: bruce amrhein
Reviews.Content: I had probably 10 videos of a white water trip. They looked awesome when played back on camera. A day later, after recharging, the pics, videos, all gone. Zip , nada, pffft. Can there be anything worse. Such a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures & videos, a great camera!
Reviews.Author: hwrose379
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when it was on sale at Costco for $40 off. I had some extra money to spend so I thought, why not? And ultimately, I'm glad I chose this camera!This camera takes really good quality pictures. I have a lot of stunning pictures that I've taken on my two grand adventures with the camera so far. Focusing is very easy as the shutter button has a very obvious halfway point. The only downside to this is that it's hard to tell whether a picture was fully in focus when it took until the picture was transferred to the computer. But other than that, this camera has a stunning picture quality...pretty amazing for such a small camera.One of the many strengths this camera has is the continuous picture mode. When this mode is switched on, you can take 10 continuous shots with one press of the shutter button (10 pictures per second). This mode is extremely useful and is extremely fun to use. I've used it numerous times as my siblings jump in the pool...I get to capture the jump, the falling, and the splash all in one continuous shot. I've also used it while taking pictures of campfires and you can get some pretty awesome fire pics with this mode.When I read that this camera can record videos in 1080p HD at 60fps, I didn't really believe it at first...until I tried it myself. It is AMAZING. The 60 frames-per-second really makes the videos feel more lifelike and it makes the experience of watching the videos much better.Perhaps the best thing about this camera is that it's waterproof. This was one of the main reasons why I bought this camera, as I wanted to get some awesome underwater pictures of my siblings while they were swimming in the pool. The waterproof feature works flawlessly and I love it so much. Recording videos underwater is amazing, too. It's awesome to record a video outside of the pool and then jump in while it's still recording. We've been working the waterproof feature to death and we love a lot of the pictures and videos we've taken so far.This camera has a very nice size...it fits into most pockets easily. It's about the size of an iPhone 4 only twice as thick. It's this thickness that may cause the camera to not fit in some pockets.All-in-all, I really enjoy this camera. It has awesome picture & video quality, and I really love the continuous shot and waterproof features. This camera is well worth the money and I'm glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: TERRIFIC camera, WATER AND SHOCK PROOF and GREAT VALUE
Reviews.Author: Tech Mom
Reviews.Content: The FinePix XP60 is a great little camera. I purchased this for my teenage son just before we went on a vacation to Costa Rica. The timing for this particular camera could not have been better.  While I was carefully removing my camera from the ziplock bag in the rainforest, my son was diving into a pristine waterfall and taking underwater photos through the crystal clear water of tiny fish.  My identically configured Fuji camera seemed suboptimal in comparison in so many ways.  It can rain anywhere, and this camera goes anywhere.  He also dropped it from horseback, naturally onto a rock, and it was fine - not a stratch.  It is so nice to have a camera that you do not have to worry about!The camera is simple to operate and takes great images.  The photos from the trip that we had blown up were all taken with this camera which outperformed my camera with identical features but which did not have the water and shock resistance.  Something else that I noticed is that direct connection image transfers were much faster from this camera than mine - also a Fugi 16 MP.The zoom feature is very good, and seems to take much better pictures from a distance.  His photos of monkeys in the trees were all very crisp and could be enlarged easily.  The camera seems to focus better at a distance than mine.I highly recommend using a very large data card in this camera, because you will be much more likely to keep this camera handy in your pocket and use it extensively.  I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: What this camera Is and Is Not
Reviews.Author: Trevor Goodchild
Reviews.Content: The Fuji XP series is one of your better choices if you want to do some simple underwater shooting. These are great cameras to take to the beach and on vacation, but sacrifices have been made.First of all, the image quality is about what you'd expect from a tiny lens system and sensor--it needs lots of light and is grainy. You'd be surprised how quickly the light falls off underwater. This camera makes a few improvements over the older XP50:* Stabilization system to assist in low light shots* Much less noticeable red shift* Improved image quality.One strange thing I noticed was the battery socket was not keyed, so you were able to put the battery in the wrong way-- so watch out for that.Overall, if you want to take pictures near or in water, this is a one of the most economical ways to do that.

Reviews.Title: Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: D. R. Sant
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera, although the mic isn't good unless it is underwater.  Perfect for travel.  Wish I had purchased the wifi one!

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the money in its class
Reviews.Author: weezee
Reviews.Content: We took this camera to Florida for vacation took pictures of all types day, night, beach, inside, underwater and so on great pictures videos are awesome couldn't have asked for much better.

Reviews.Title: This camera survived 9 days on the Colorado river!
Reviews.Author: Mandy Schoen
Reviews.Content: I choose this camera for our 9 day river rafting trip through the Grand Canyon.  After reading many reviews of disappointment for it not being good at taking underwater pictures, I was kind of on the fence. Even though I wasn't planning on taking under water pictures, I still needed a good camera (not expensive either) that would survive the trip. This is a great point and shoot camera! I was able to get nice scenery pictures on the water and on the trails. No problems! Great battery life too! Over the course of 9 days I only used 3 batteries and took over 600 pictures.  Great value! And it's not much bigger than a smart phone, just a bit thicker.

Reviews.Title: Mother's Day Gift
Reviews.Author: Michael Loveday
Reviews.Content: Bought it as a gift and my mother loves it very much. Easy to use even for tech challenged  people. Glad I purchased.

Reviews.Title: Great for the $$
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: Love it!!!!! Awesome pictures.  Took it to water park and fishing. Held up great. Pic come out nice and clear under and above water

Reviews.Title: Great Quality for Price!!!
Reviews.Author: Nate P
Reviews.Content: I purchased the XP60 for roughing and tumbling in obstacle mud races and underwater shooting.....it has yet to let me down!!!

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: I B Cookin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it is dust & water proof. I like to take it along with me when I sail. I don't have to worry about it getting wet. Also, because it is dust proof, I don't have to worry about getting dust on my sensor that cause little spots in my images. This camera has a lot of features to play around with. I enjoy the rapid shot and the panoramic feature.

Reviews.Title: Great Water Camera
Reviews.Author: Devin B
Reviews.Content: I take this camera on the river with me and it takes great pictures and videos. The picture quality is up to my standards, it is waterproof, and the price I got it for makes it so that if it gets lost I won't be too upset. I took some cool videos with it while rafting and the sound quality was good too. I would recommend buying an extra battery or two.

Reviews.Title: Ok for most photos
Reviews.Author: Christopher Steltzlen
Reviews.Content: I was NOT impressed with the zoom and the manual to use it is over in inch thick and must be printed on your computer.  Also, the memory card did not come with the camera. I really needed a waterproof camera with a zoom for bird watching.  Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Camera works well and takes impressive photos. This is a must have for anyone that takes photos at the beach, lake, or pool!!

Reviews.Title: Great value - submersed many times and dropped quite a few times then still worked
Reviews.Author: Raymond
Reviews.Content: I bought my second one of these from Amazon because for the price this camera is a good value. I have completely submerged this camera at least four dozen times while filming fish I am bringing in to my kayak. I have done kayak surf launches where this thing becomes totally soaked and I have taken it to the dusty desert and this camera never had dust inside the lens. I have owned my first one  of these cameras for a year. I get decent battery life and good video quality. In fact this thing is way better than my GoPro (which gets zero battery life and sucks). It's either this camera of the Lumix which my friend has. I don't think either one is better.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Patty Tanner
Reviews.Content: It is what I was looking for and so much more. I love it! I've already gotten more pics of my daughter than I've been able to get in years.

Reviews.Title: worth the money!
Reviews.Author: Holly Ganz
Reviews.Content: It works perfect for what I need it for.  I film alot of mudding events and when I got splashed it keep right on working.  Excited to try it under water

Reviews.Title: cool underwater pics
Reviews.Author: PlaynDoc
Reviews.Content: we took this on our disney dream cruise.  swimming pool pictures are quite sharp; in the ocean water, a bit cloudy.  the camera will see what a person would see, wearing swim goggles.  can't expect better than that.  along with a 32 gig card, we took a whole hellava lot of pictures, and never worried about filling the card.  great photos on shore, too.  the only thing that would be an added cool factor, would be a better/closer zoom feature.

Reviews.Title: XP60
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: Researched this underwater camera against other brands on Amazon and on you tube for picture and video quality. Used it on our Caribbean vacation 3/2014. Highly recommend this camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Unit
Reviews.Author: Charles Webb
Reviews.Content: Love Camera but came with no box or manual.I sent an email to seller asking if he had the Camera manual or knerw where I could obtain but received no reply.I beleive there should have been disclosure that there was no box or manual for this Camera. I like the Camera!

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: Lynn Latham
Reviews.Content: Great underwater camera!  Got it for my trip to Mexico and it was very easy to use and pictures turned out great!

Reviews.Title: Great item!
Reviews.Author: Grace Szeja
Reviews.Content: Best camera I have ever owned! I take it on mud runs and it survived! Great if you have small children too.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, especially for the price.
Reviews.Author: Michael Ament
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, clear photos.  And amazing underwater feature!Used this camera for a vacation and it took great scenic shots, and was tons of fun to use in the pool.

Reviews.Title: It exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: wanda wright
Reviews.Content: It was a gift for my adult son who started using it immediately.  It takes very good quality photos and was a huge hit

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Diver Jan
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for a few days and had to take it back.  The flash button didn't work - the flash never would come on.  The button for macro also didn't work.  The picture quality is very bad and the zoom didn't work very well either.  I was hoping to have a camera for snorkeling rather than have to use my big u/w camera - well, I still don't have an option that works.  could have returned it for a new one but decided to not give another one a try.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product.
Reviews.Author: nando
Reviews.Content: It Was much more than what i Was expecting. Inside the water it works very well, it is a really a good câmera.

Reviews.Title: 5 star because...
Reviews.Author: Jey85
Reviews.Content: it takes underwater CLEAR pictures!!!!!!! my camera didn't come with a sd card but that's fine anyway because I will buy a good quality card. overall its a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a week long cruise through the Caribbean.  It worked flawlessly.  Awesome underwater shots, great pictures from parasailing, snorkeling, playing in the sand.  I love everything about it and I didn't have a single problem.  Definitely worth it for the price point!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Central Wyoming College - Library
Reviews.Content: Has great features and easy to use.  Still learning but used it for capturing pictures of the three new babies in the family over a weekend and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: Danielle Burruss
Reviews.Content: Fast delivery. Love the camera. Bought it for out trip to Maldives to take photos underwater. Very excited about using it.

Reviews.Title: perfect camera
Reviews.Author: Robin L. Haggerty
Reviews.Content: We had the older generation and loved it as well as wore it out.  We had to replace it so naturally we turned to Amazon and the camera we know and trust.  Super happy to hit the vacation excursions, typically snorkeling and snap away at the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Camera did not leak
Reviews.Author: Albert Holm
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife to use during our Hawaiian vacation. She used it during six snorkeling excursions of an hour or more and did not have any difficulties (except for forgetting the charger at home; luckily my charger worked for her batteries).

Reviews.Title: Water sports
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: For several years I have used the older version of this camera. Kayaking and hiking, water, rain, dropping are no longer issues for me.  This purchase was a gift for my husband and he is learning the features. The closing latch has changed from the older camera but it is relatively easy to use. It has many settings for different type photos and I have had good results. Best of all no waterproof case required. I keep a small waterproof case attached to it when paddling or swimming so it doesnt sink. For the money

Reviews.Title: Battery DOA
Reviews.Author: Lucal
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these cameras from 2 different sellers. When I change out the battery this camera works. The problem is that it is a special battery that I cannot find anywhere and it was a broken gift out of the box that seriously disappointed my daughter who could not use it on our vacation. The other camera that the gloating sister got to use took nice underwater pictures and was enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: What a great camera
Reviews.Author: R. Browning "t5grrr"
Reviews.Content: Took it to Costa Rica and used it in the surf, underwater, etc. never a problem and great battery life. Remember to rinse it as per instructions to prevent salt water corrosion though!Very nice photos, far superior to most other small point and shoot cameras.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for our 5 year old son
Reviews.Author: nordkat
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for a 5 year old son for Christmas because he loves to take pictures.  He was able to operate it without any instruction from us.  (Caveat: He has used digital cameras before.)  We feel safe because it has that 5-foot drop protection.  It's very rugged and well made.  And our son is excited to use it underwater at the pool this summer.  We picked yellow because it's easier to find than black or a dark color when he 'loses it' in the house.  I would recommend this camera to other parents.  And for adults who want a rugged camera.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Jarboe
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for a snorkeling trip and loved it. It took great pictures and video. Will certainly use it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: Lovely Shade of Green!
Reviews.Author: John Beard
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my 9 year old grand daughter.She is approving of this camera so far and that is all that needs to be said!Actually she told Santa she wanted a "GREEN" camera, that limited the field a lot.This camera seems to be everything one could ask for in this price range, plus it is water proof to a shallow depth.I paid more for MY camera that did not have rechargeable batteries.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: mona "annec@ioa.com"
Reviews.Content: I got this for a 10 year old and she figured most of it out on her own.  We have only taken pictures inside the fish tank (fun), but we can't wait to try some pool shots.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: MissingBj "Karen"
Reviews.Content: Good little camera - decent price -  I used it under water & near water on a trip.  It was nice to not worry about getting it wet while, sailing, paddle boarding, etc.  took great shots of the kids in the pool under the water.  Have not tried it yet in the snow.  If it lasts ---- it is a winner...

Reviews.Title: Performed well
Reviews.Author: Ed Hillman
Reviews.Content: Bought this to take on a high altitude trek; it performed well -- no freezing or dust problems; clear pictures remained sharp when made to poster size.  Will take it under water in 2014; stay tuned.

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera for snorkeling.
Reviews.Author: DAVID L EVANS
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to take on a cruise and do some snorkeling. I worked perfectly and the pictures came out great. We were in about 8-12 feet of water and I got some really nice clear photos underwater. I took it jet skiing and got some really good photos just by reaching down and holding it underwater. The camera always works and never leaked.

Reviews.Title: Best buy among snorkeling cameras
Reviews.Author: manatee
Reviews.Content: I chose this model over its "big brother" (FinePix XP200) because it's smaller, lighter and has a longer battery life. I would have liked the Wi-Fi connection of the XP200, but I don't need my fish recorded in stereo.  Neither camera is capable of accompanying me to scuba depths. That requires a separate housing to keep the water out. If you can free dive deeper than 20 feet or so, consider the XP200.  It is rated for deeper depths than the XP60, but this one is fine for snorkeling along the surface with an occasional dip deeper.  I took it on a recent beach trip to Curacao and it met my expectations.  I didn't find a lot of difference in color rendition between the "underwater" recording mode and the surface modes but coloration can be corrected by computer processing.  At least this camera didn't leak and you're warned not to open the access door without drying the camera off. I followed the warning and had no problem. But remember, this IS an underwater camera with a non-protrucding lens behind an optical-glass screen. You can probably find less expensive cameras that will take equally good or better pictures than the XP60 (especially as regards contrast and definition) but they won't go swimming with you!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: mehtap cicek
Reviews.Content: I got it for Christmas today and it works better than my past camera (a Panasonic lumix) it has good sound quality and zooms really good!!

Reviews.Title: Crap!
Reviews.Author: Joshua S.
Reviews.Content: Two days of use at beach and pool and it stopped working.  The "door" was correctly shut as the photos it took look pretty good!Now it's not charging (can't even tell if it is) and not turning on.  After 24hr dry out time still dead.  Glad Target has a 30 return policy on this crap. Now stuck in Puerto Rico without a back-up camera!!  Stupid move, I know.

Reviews.Title: Used it in the Caribbean and worked excellent!
Reviews.Author: Brad Towle "photo freak"
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the quality of the camera and the clarity of the pictures.  Love the features on it.  Did not have any problems underwater, even up to 18 ft deep. I just wish the water wasn't as stirred up by the trade winds! I would highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Nice looking camera
Reviews.Author: Oscar P Juarez
Reviews.Content: I like the looks on the camera. and I can wait to go to the beach and use it. I want to see how it does under the water.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful for the price
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera right before an October cruise to the Bahamas because our other underwater camera completely died on us.  I'm very happy with the picture quality, and the video setting is really easy to use.  It definitely works for snorkeling, and I'm looking forward to using it again in March for our Western Caribbean port stops.

Reviews.Title: I like Love the color
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: The product appears to function as described, but have not had long enough to activate all its capabilities.  I wish it came with a printed manual.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Yoshio Saito "Aloha"
Reviews.Content: I know I cannot expect a lot for this camera because it is just $150! So, it works well and not bad. Easy to use, handy but we cannot expect high quality water photos. Maybe the quality of lens is not good. But it's OK.

Reviews.Title: Slow Speed
Reviews.Author: Mimi
Reviews.Content: This camera is very slow when trying to take back to back pictures.  Also, some pictures come out blurry if taken too fast.  At other times, if the subject is moving, it will also be blurry.  When I first received the camera, this was not the case and now, it seems to be getting slower and slower.  I tried some of the different settings also.

Reviews.Title: Camera with fresh look
Reviews.Author: Ehrmann, Marc
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, first pictures seem to have good quality, intented as present for a child, just delivered (Nov 2013), therefore durability to be proofed in future

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: DAVID GARRETT
Reviews.Content: We are getting excellent photos in the Pool of our 3 year old daughter. The high speed feature is great for getting action shots of her jumping in. The quality of the under water photos and video is fantastic. The Auto feature that selected the correct mode works so well we have never manually selected a camera mode.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Nate
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Takes really good pictures. Never did get to use it in the water as we planned. BUT it did get wet by accident and there was no problems with it.

Reviews.Title: Best purchase I ever made!
Reviews.Author: SP
Reviews.Content: Great product!  Took great pictures in and out of water.  Very fast.. Was able to take multiple shots of fish very quickly!  Would totally recommend for those tropical people!

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof as advertised
Reviews.Author: Nature Lover
Reviews.Content: Considering its low price it takes okay photos.  Simple controls. Excellent low light pics.  After using it for a couple of weeks for underwater pics in Tahiti it developed moisture problems. This is unacceptable. The camera was never more than 3 feet under water at any time.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix XP60 digital camera
Reviews.Author: Jean P. Colbert
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera - I still have a lot to explore about its options. I found it easy to use - and pictures came out in focus even when taken from a moving boat or bus.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Roberto
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. Pictures and video underwater are just amazing. High definition quality and lots of pictures on a single 8 gb memory

Reviews.Title: Great for paddlers!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Purpose, intended use:  I bought this for kayaking and Canoeing... fresh water use..Quality of pictures uploaded: It takes good pictures but not great for action pictures.  Movies/video taking works fine.  some have come out blurry.  I need to learn how to get a faster shutter speed for action photos.  When I am still and allowing time to focus it works great.Pros: It is Waterproof, it does download easy,Cons: It doesn't come with a memory card and the internal memory is small.  So, You need to buy a memory card for it.  The owners manual doesn't tell you what you need so you have to research it.General Summary opinion:  I like it because it is an easy to use one hand camera while out on the river.  fBought it on Amazon because I couldn't get the Sam's club cheaper purchase, So for the $, I think it was a good buy.  I am happy with it and will use it and learn to take better pics with it.  I am very active, my family is very active in water.

Reviews.Title: Good enough for rough work!
Reviews.Author: Gene A. Dobbins Jr.
Reviews.Content: This camera was used by myself  and my Grandson with no problems. Video was easy and clear and pictures were very  clear as well. I was a little skeptical of the claims and good reviews but  am pleased that this camera performs very well. I ordered a second battery and charger but the original battery seems to last at least for several hundred pictures all on large fine. The SR (scene recognition) setting seems to work very well . One needs to remember that the lens is near the upper left so fingers don't show up but otherwise it is very intuitive. I do prefer my Canon SX 10 IS digital for serious work as it allows for external flash, 20X magnification and more controllable and creative settings but on program the Canon and Fuji XP 60 on SR pictures seem about the same quality. My Grandson took it into the water but the water was so murky that the results were inconclusive. I plan on taking the  camera into a pool and seeing what the underwater setting will look like. I like the price, the compactness, the ease of use and the many settings that are possible with the Fuji.I should get a floating wrist strap as I worried about my Grandson losing the camera but he kept the included strap on and it worked. It came with a small camera case but I needed to have a bigger one to carry the charger and the battery as well as the camera. It is a Lowepro compact camera case and fits everything perfectly. The camera  also came with an 8gb SD card which surprised me. I downloaded the manual from Fuji's site and saved it to documents as the quick setup manual that comes with it is not the most complete.Overall I would recommend this camera to anyone needing a pretty durable, waterproof and sand proof camera so they could save the DSLR from sand and surf problems and still get very good pictures and HD video.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Gerry McD
Reviews.Content: I like the pictures it takes, but the instruction manual is a little weak and disorganized. I have not exposed the camera to a wet environment yet.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kathryn J. Amiel
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 16 year old granddaughter.  She uses it everyday and loves it.  It is very sturdy and if you have a teenager you know how careless they can be.  This stands up to the test.

Reviews.Title: Stuck cmos pixels
Reviews.Author: Kevin Fitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: I got my camera from Costco. Build quality looks good and I like the locking knob on the battery door. I got this camera to take on vacation for use in the water, however it did not pass the standard test. I took several pictures and videos to ensure the camera works before I leave for vacation. I knew not to expect great quality, but that ok since it was just for water use. I reviewed the pics and vids and found a lot of white specs in them. There was many stuck CMOS pixels. Any dark object was like a starry sky. I googled this issue and could not find anyway to perform pixel mapping. I think the amount of bad CMOS pixels I had were excessive. I think Fuji should have used a good 12MP CMOS instead of the 16MP (seems more like a sales pitch). If it were not for the pixel issue I would have kept it. I decided to try something different since I saw no way to perform pixel mapping. Any one here know how?

Reviews.Title: LOVE this little camera!
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: Amazing quality for the price.  I purchased for my honeymoon because I wanted to be able to take underwater pictures and video.  It does both things quite well.  I was able to zoom in to get crisp shots of sea life as well as action shots of birds in motion.  Sometimes the camera has difficulty adapting to low lighting when on auto, but the sunset and low light settings seem to do the trick.  Macro pictures and panoramas also turned out quite well.

Reviews.Title: hard to keep lens clean
Reviews.Author: D. Dwin "D.Dwin"
Reviews.Content: i've had this camera for several weeks kayaking and at the beach.  an image sensor defect left a black dot and required a swap at costco.  it takes pretty good photos, and you don't have to worry about getting it wet - which has ruined a few low cost point and shoots for me.  the most difficult thing for me is keeping thevlens clean.  its right where your fingers want tp grab the camera.  also, beads of water will ruin your shots.  this is probably true of other waterproofs because none have lens covers (manual or automatic) for between shots.  now i carry a bunch of disposable lense wipes, but that's a pain.  i wonder if rainx would work, but i would hate to prmenantly cloud the lense if it doesn't.

Reviews.Title: Fine pix
Reviews.Author: Sal
Reviews.Content: Superb under water; excellent beach and extreme low light situations. Multiple settings: very easy software--intuitive. Big screen, easy to see text while snorkeling . Best value out there .But....factory battery drains waaaay too quickly. Get online and spend another $9.00 for third party, higher power battery and life is sweet.I've owned dozens of point/shoot uw cameras. Fuji got it right this time for price/portability .

Reviews.Title: 3rd underwater camera and so far it has survived.
Reviews.Author: Nancy Z
Reviews.Content: I run through underwater cameras pretty often.This camera is very durable.Battery lasts forever.Great photos and videosuper fast as processing.My fav part is when you flip back through photos to show people it offers a thumbnail view that is very fast.Bout the size of a wallet (with some money in it)

Reviews.Title: love it!!!!
Reviews.Author: Sandra Rullan
Reviews.Content: Excellent photos, excellent resolution, the best waterproof camera. I using all the time in my kayak fishing days. I make a videos, best buy ever!!!

Reviews.Title: Digideals4less & Roger A. on the Fujifilm Fine Pix XP60
Reviews.Author: Virginia Drake
Reviews.Content: This camera is a good little camera for a family with kids.  It's hardy, and stands up to it's claims.  If you're going through looking for a refurbished camera and looking to be confident about dealing with a "seller" company, Digideals4less is definitely a great company run by an extremely kind individual.  He is superb in his ability to "MAKE IT RIGHT!"  You just don't find that everywhere and it is clear why he has a 5 star rating!

Reviews.Title: Great vacation camera
Reviews.Author: chaos
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera with a lot of nice features. It is 16 MP, it has 5X optical zoom. It has a burst mode which will take several pictures in quick succession. This is a really cool feature. While the pictures I took in this mode were not all perfectly focused, they were okay enough to have fun with this mode. This feature works much better outdoors in good lighting. When I tried it indoors the movement was all out of focus.This camera has 23 shooting modes to choose from! While it's good to have a lot of choices, it can also be frustrating having to scroll through so many before getting to the one you want. There is no dial on the outside of the camera to quickly change the shooting mode. It is done in the menu section.The picture quality of this camera is pretty good. I like that this camera is so durable. Having a camera that is water proof, shock proof, takes good quality pictures, takes good quality video, and is small enough to fit in my purse makes this a good choice as a vacation camera.I find that the dial/lock to open the side battery/SD card compartment to be very annoying. You have to press the tiny button while turning the dial. This is really hard to do.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but battery time is lacking
Reviews.Author: Cat
Reviews.Content: We got this camera as a last minute purchase for our California vacation. We wanted a small camera that could take some punishment. We got this one wet, sandy and dropped it. It held up. The picture quality is good and it was nice to have a small camera to take to places. I have a very nice and rather expensive Cannon that is still my favorite but when I need a smaller one, I will be taking the Fuji. My only complaint about it is that it sucks the battery dry. We spent a long day at Seaworld and the camera died 2 hours before we were done at the park. I've had Fuji cameras before and had the same issue and would always carry extra batteries. Unfortunately, I couldn't get a spare battery on our trip. I just had to make sure to charge it every night and just use it as long as it lasted the next day.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Sonya Ramirez
Reviews.Content: Exactly what it says. videos don't download to ipad well. Will be checking into video apps to correct this. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Not worth one star!
Reviews.Author: Mr Richard Fan
Reviews.Content: Add me to the owned six months and the repair needed to fix is not under warranty.  How convenient.  The HDMI pins are bent due to my supposed shoving the charger in the wrong hole.  Seriously.  I can manage to charge items that cost much more than this but I can't figure out which hole a charger goes into ?!?!?!  I bet there would be less 5 star ratings after people realize how easily this camera breaks.Done with Fuji.  DONE.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: JH "parent"
Reviews.Content: First one never worked, replacement lasted one trip.  Terrible quality, complete waste of money.  Really disappointing for the entire family.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera! But Definitely Read the Manual :)
Reviews.Author: Tracey Carter
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It takes beautiful pictures, is compact, sturdy, and easy to use. It's great to be able to have a camera I can safely throw in my purse and take everywhere.It takes pictures faster and the flash resets much more quickly than on my old Nikon CoolPix. The battery life has been great. I've charged it once since I received it last month. Overall I couldn't be more pleased with it.The one negative thing I have to say about the camera is that some of the features and the menu weren't intuitive to use initially. There was a small learning curve, but if I had taken the time to read the manual I might've had an easier time. It may also be because my previous camera was a point-and-shoot Nikon which uses a slightly different menu structure than the Fujuifilm FinePix.When I was first setting up the camera the beeping every time I pushed a button was driving both my boyfriend and I crazy, however, I had a LOT of difficulty changing the key push to silent because I had first changed some other setting while taking some photos and didn't realize that once I put it on a specific mode I was unable to change some of the other settings. After ten minutes of frustration and frantically flipping through the relatively small but informative manual I was able to realize where I had gone wrong, but as a well-educated reasonably-intelligent individual I was aggravated that I had to resort to reading the manual. However, all that aside I really do like this camera and it's a great replacement for my old Nikon and it's so great to not worry about throwing it my purse and taking it to a ballgame or anywhere else.If the menu was slightly easier to navigate and I could have more easily figured how to change some of the settings I'd gladly give this camera five stars.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera!
Reviews.Author: D. H.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, I use it mostly to take pictures and videos of my 3yr. old grandson. It takes great action shots, and the clarity of the videos are awesome. I have also used this underwater in the pool, and the pictures and videos come out great. This is a wonderful camera to take on vacation, because it is very durable as well. I have dropped it several times, and thank God it is shatter proof, because if this was any other camera, I would be out of luck. The battery holds a charge for a pretty long time, the only thing that I really wish, is that it had a longer charging wire. It is very short, and I have to make sure I have an outlet with a table right next to it. Other then that, I am very satisfied with this camera. Now my daughter wants me to buy her one!

Reviews.Title: Either the battery or the camera or the charger is Faulty
Reviews.Author: creamycharb
Reviews.Content: I will change my review once I get this issue resolved. Right out of the package i tried to charge the battery. I had it plugged in overnight. the red light on the charger never went out, and the camera would never turn on.I will be returning it.its a shame too, as it was a birthday present, and i wont get a replacement item soon enough for the big day.hopefully i will get this returned and resolved and be able to update my review.

Reviews.Title: Sweet
Reviews.Author: E. Joel Guthrie
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures! All that I hoped for and more out of this little guy. I have big hands but had no trouble using it once I got familar with the controls.

Reviews.Title: It's ok.
Reviews.Author: Lynn
Reviews.Content: This review may not offer you much insight.  I bought it for my son to use while caving; he liked the micro function of his Nikon Coolpix camera for taking pictures of insects, salamanders, frogs, bats, etc., but was looking for a waterproof camera.  This camera did not live up to his expectations for picture-taking abilities compared to his old camera.  So we returned it.  I don't believe he ever tried out the waterproof aspects of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good quality pictures and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We took pictures with this camera both in and out of the water during our last vacation, and the quality is really nice. Plus I like the one-touch movie recording button, which makes it very easy to record a video without messing with dials. One note, though: the battery runs out FAST. When I used the camera for a full-day outing, I definitely had to charge it that night so that it would last through the next day. Plus there's a note in the manual that says the battery charge runs out even when the camera is NOT in use, so you'll want to charge it right before you want to use it.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Works well both under water and above.  Sharp pictures.  Easy to use.  Pictures are much better than from disposable underwater cameras.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Todd Silaika
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing underwater photos -- it was perfect for our family vacation -- the added features of high quality out-of-water pictures is pretty awesome too!  There are really cool settings for the camera (adding a hint of sparkle, monochrome with a hint of color, among others).

Reviews.Title: Amazing pictures
Reviews.Author: Eric Powell
Reviews.Content: I just recently bought this for my cruise and cave tubing adventures and bought the Sony 64GB SDHC/SDXC Class 10 memory card.. what a perfect combination. This camera takes amazimg photos and video and performs amazingly well.  The bettery seems to hold it's own too. I bought a spare battery but have not had to use it yet but always have "just in case" anyways.  You'll ne happy with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera is great!  Got it to keep my 8 & 10 year old off my cell phone camera.  I now use it as much as they do!  TONS of features that really improve picture quality. My favorite is a dual pic function that takes every pic twice, one with flash and one without.  This function has made taking pics for ebay product sales turn out great.  Easy enough for kids to use and I don't worry about them breaking it.  I recommend buying a 32G SD card and a stick and find fob to accompany this so you can find the camera when the kids have wandered off with it.

Reviews.Title: Camera is flawed but FujiFilm came through
Reviews.Author: Julie Groninger
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for our daughters birthday in August.  She used the camera for a vacation in November.  In January, she said the camera would not charge.  I decided to buy a new battery.  The new battery did not charge.  I sent the camera to the FujiFilm to be repaired under warranty.  They denied the warranty stating that the HDMI pins were bent.  We never used the HDMI port.  The camera charges from the USB port.  I contacted the repair center manager and never received a call back.  I have sent several e-mails asking for some assistance.  The only response I received was to contact the repair center to get our issue addressed.  This was the third FujiFilm camera we have purchased, but will probably never buy one again.UPDATE:  We finally got in touch with a manager at FujiFilm repair center.  He explained that it appears that my daughter may have put the plug in the wrong port to charge the camera (to her defense, the ports are almost identical looking).  This caused a pin in the HDMI port to break off and short out the camera destroying the board in the camera.  FujiFilm repair center agreed to reduce the repair cost and actually gave us a new camera and a battery charger we could plug in instead of directly charging the camera.  We are happy that they finally have addressed this and hope they change the design or provide a battery charger with future models.  We have upgraded our rating as the pictures the camera takes are decent but we have spent quite a bit of money on it.

Reviews.Title: Super little camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: ralph castelucci
Reviews.Content: Bought this little camera in February '14 for a cruise vacation. I'm a Photographer by trade and definitely didn't want to take my 'good' cameras out in the sun and sand and most definitely not in the water.I used this for the entire week and got some SUPER photos!! I have to say, I was very impressed!!I took it a good 15 feet under the water and swam with it on my arm (with a floating camera strap on my wrist) for hours. It did SUPER! No hesitation recommending this camera. 100% excellent for sun and fun and water play and also from the boat and shore.  Will try to post some pics from the camera.  I bought the green color and it's very pretty and fun!

Reviews.Title: ALL FUN NO WORRY
Reviews.Author: Barbara L. Gartland "cabincrazy"
Reviews.Content: EVERYTHING I WANT IN A CAMERA THATS JUST FOR PLAY.I SWAM WITH IT IN THE ISLANDS AND SNOWSHOED IN WISCONSIN.

Reviews.Title: quality
Reviews.Author: zenaida
Reviews.Content: It is everything I expected in this product I really charm throughout both the quality and duration thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: NO memory card included
Reviews.Author: J. Kellner "oohjk"
Reviews.Content: There are several posts indicating a memory card is included - NO MEMORY CARD IS INCLUDED.  Budget an extra $20 to get the memory card separately.

Reviews.Title: Wrong Battery Sent...Need a Customer Service Number if any of you have one?????
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: Well, I think it will be great when we actually get to use it.  It came in a week later than the expected delivery, which was already weeks after ordering it.  Then when we opened the package, there was only a CD manual and not even a professional box to hold the camera...odd.  At any rate, I don't know who to contact to let them know that they accidentally sent the wrong battery.  The battery they sent won't fit the charger or the camera.  So when I find all this out and let them know that I am sure it was an honest mistake and to please send the correct battery, I am very sure that it will be just perfect for my 7 year old!

Reviews.Title: Takes excellent pictures!
Reviews.Author: Dion "D Coker"
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our cruise and I must say, this has to be one of the better point and shoot cameras I've owned! At first I didn't think it was taking good pictures at all, but that was actually due to the LCD screen. Once we got home and I moved them onto my pc, the pictures were phenomenal! Takes excellent moving pictures as long as your ready (it does take a an extra second or two to focus, but that's normal for any camera) I was even able to take several pics of a waterplane taking off while standing on the deck of the cruise ship in a summer rain storm and the pics of that came out crisp and clear. I definitely recommend this camera! One extra thing I would recommend is that you also buy the warranty that is offered with it. Your buying a ruggedized camera, not a bouncy ball, and accidents happen!

Reviews.Title: IMPRESSIVE PICS FOR THE PRICE
Reviews.Author: Bargain Hunter
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about buying this camera because many of the comments implied it takes inferior pictures.  I bought it because I was going snorkeling while on a cruise.  The photos we took while snorkeling were great.  Don't hesitate to buy this camera.  Yeah, there are better ones out there (there always are) but if you don't want to put a lot of money into a camera but need the underwater feature...pick this one.  I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: James B. Coates
Reviews.Content: I am amazed at the quality of the pictures this camera takes.  It gets a good picture in very low light.  I purchased it mainly for saltwater/fresh water use while fishing and kayaking.  Numerous programs including auto, night, beach, and others.I would recommend this camera especially for outdoor and sports use.

Reviews.Title: Good camera - love the underwater feature!
Reviews.Author: TexasGirl
Reviews.Content: This is a really good camera for vacation.  It takes good pictures and works underwater.  I use mine not only on vacation around water, but also for pool parties and other activities during the summer where the is a pool or lake involved.  If you buy the floating wrist strap, makes it really easy to keep track of.I have no real issues with the camera - typical controls, easy to use, takes decent pictures.  The only real downside is the size - it's a little too big for your pocket - does fit but not so comfortable.  That said, it's small enough to carry around and is lightweight.I liked it enough to buy one for my friend for her birthday, so would definitely recommend.  I'd just prefer it be a bit smaller.

Reviews.Title: Not too bad for a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: sabre03
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to supplement my dslr. It obviously isn't as good as a dslr, but for a point and shoot it's the best one out of four I've had. The action shot's tend to come out blurry, but otherwise the picture quality is pretty good. It's been used in the rain and been splashed with water and still works well. For what it is, and the price I thought it was a descent buy.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: ZZMom
Reviews.Content: After spending countless hours reading reviews of waterproof cameras, I purchased the Fujifilm FinePix XP60 16 MP for our family trip to Belize.  Some folks complain that the image quality isn't that great, but it's an inexpensive point and shoot.  For the price, it is durable, user-friendly, takes good pictures, and most importantly, remains dry! It survived cave tubing and a full week of snorkeling--2-3 hours in the water daily.  There are a lot of imaging options, so if you take a few minutes getting to know the camera before jumping off the boat, it's a breeze to use. The battery life was very good.  I only charged it every other day or so, and that was just to make sure I would be ready to go.  I really like the closure to the battery compartment.  It's a little tricky to open/close the first time, but I felt very secure in that fact that the camera would remain leak-proof.  When I was shopping around, I was surprised at how some other models didn't seem as watertight or durable.We made videos, took low light nighttime pictures, and pretty much gave this camera a run for its money on our 2 week adventure.  I'm looking forward to taking it on another trip soon, as I know it will capture our memories wonderfully.  If I had to complain about anything, I would like better zoom, but really--It's hard enough to photograph a barracuda without worrying about zooming in on that scary grin.  For our purposes, this was the perfect camera and I am 100% happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: Good camera I don't worry about breaking
Reviews.Author: Darren Griffith
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this camera is that when mountain biking, SUPing, etc. it doesn't break.  It has several nice features, like taking HDR photos.  Several features are a bit too automatic, which makes them hard to use; like the panorama mode.  Overall it takes nice photos that can be shared on line or via a digital frame.  I haven't tried printing any yet.  The photos aren't quite as nice as my other compact camera nor the SLR.  Of course neither of those are waterproof.

Reviews.Title: takes great pictures
Reviews.Author: darla wotherspoon
Reviews.Content: So far this camera is taking great pictures and is fairly simple to operate. Pictures are clear and full of color. Haven't put it to the water test yet but will be soon. With the 32GB memory card it's more than fast enough to take the action shots we wanted. So Far the battery life is pretty good. It will last all day on for pictures. Haven't tested battery life on videos yet.

Reviews.Title: Toughness will be tested
Reviews.Author: Kevin Wilcox
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so I could record pictures and videos of my Thanksgiving trip with family. Got home afterwards, satisfied with the hours of video we took and excitedly told my family I'd have an edited video for us within a couple weeks. I was looking forward to providing everyone with a quality production of our time together, but alas that won't happen.After 3 hours of struggling to get the files off my camera, onto the computer, and view them in a workable format I have finally conceded that every single one of my videos and pictures is corrupt and can not be opened. I have downloaded 10-15 programs of varying levels of shadiness trying to fix the broken videos, after it had already taken an hour of problems just to get 10% of the files off this thing and onto my computer. Every program I've tried has said the same thing: "File can not be opened". ALL of the videos and pictures I took are worthless and the time I spent trying to get quality shots of my family was a complete waste.We're not trying to be the Kardashians but I did want a nice compilation of memories for my family; apparently I made the wrong decision when I bought this piece of junk. I will try to return the camera to Amazon tomorrow, and if they won't take it I am going to happily smash this thing into bits. I guarantee the "tough" BS will not withstand my rage.*EDIT*Amazon did take my return and I'm very grateful, I've always been impressed the customer service of this company. My opinion on this camera, however, does not change. I'll even point out I tested taking a couple pictures on the internal memory to see if maybe the memory card was corrupt. Nope, the camera itself stored every image and video in a format that can't be opened or used.

Reviews.Title: Bought this to take outdoor video
Reviews.Author: Ken from Honolulu "Aloha!"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to buy the Canon D20 but this was such a deal and after reading the reviews here on Amazon, decided to get it. 90% of my online purchases are from Amazon but I saw this on sale at at Costco for $140 and decided to get it. I bought this strictly to take video at the beach or at the pool but haven't got a chance to yet. I have used it indoors and some of the videos were bad. The still pictures, for the most part, were pretty good. I will update this review after I get a chance to take it out in the water.FYI: What was in the package / box1. float strap2. 8GB SDHC (class 4) card3. charger w/ usb cord4. case5. manual (not very detailed) & other literature6. software7. L-Ion battery8. carrying strap9. cameraUpdate: Shortly after my original post, I took this out to Waikiki and the waves were small so it was perfect to try it out. To make it short, the video wasn't what i expected so I decided to return this camera a few days later and just save up for something better.

Reviews.Title: Alright Fujifilm, I'll give you another chance.
Reviews.Author: Armando N. Roman
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm first got under my skin a few years ago when I got a point and shoot digital camera by them that was supposed to be the "best" one at the store. It ended up taking pictures that looked like they were shot by the first phone to feature a camera. I took it back to the store in less than 24 hours, after trying to get good photos in dozens of different places, with different lighting conditions and with all the settings, and was much happier with the Samsung model I swapped it out for. And now, here I am, 4-5 years after that first disaster, giving a product of theirs 5 stars.The FinePix XP60, despite coming in a goofy array of colors, is one of the better point and shoots I've seen in a couple of years. I'm no camera expert, and everything I learned in photography class 11 years ago has went out the window, so let me just say that all this camera has earned the mostly positive reviews here. It's fast to take pictures, doesn't take seconds to get ready for another one, and performs perfectly underwater. It's cool to be recording a video above water, then going under and coming back up to finish a shot, as basic as it may seem. Kids will love taking this little doozy into the pool with them, and there's a good chance they'll be filming some pretty fun things with it.This camera was made for trips to the beach or the pool. Be sure to get a big memory card if you plan on giving this one to the kids for a little bit!

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera, terrible video, just plain awful.
Reviews.Author: S Surveyor "Amazonion"
Reviews.Content: The lens on this camera is so bad, every picture's resolution is worthless at the edges.  Video and picture quality is ruined by the terrible sensor.  Noise and fuzz, shimmering skies, you name it this camera does it worse than most.  Even bright sunny days (don't even try less than full sun or indoors) result in terrible results.  It's the worst camera I've ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Worth the buy
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: The waterproofing and underwater aspect were great. It has good low light qualities but seems to over expose on any setting during some types of lighting environments. Overall, worth it, very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera: under or above water!
Reviews.Author: Troy
Reviews.Content: Good camera, seamless operation and good quality shots. Highly recommended for your casual daily use camera, trips, or capturing great moments underwater.

Reviews.Title: Worked Great on the Honeymoon!
Reviews.Author: RyanG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a waterproof camera so we could take pictures on our honeymoon to Punta Cana. After doing lots of research, I eventually purchased this camera based off of the reviews.The camera worked great; we were in either the ocean or pool pretty much all day, and we never had a leaking problem or any issues with the camera.The picture quality was great, and we were able to get some pretty cool shots in the water. The buttons and interface was easy to use/learn as well. Its nice to have a instant video record button, and not have to switch settings around.I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Kay J. Leick "Kay"
Reviews.Content: I like the fact that the camera is small and able to use it in water. It takes good pictures. I use this camera when I don't want to carry my bigger camera along with me and when in the water.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Roberto Valadez
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my family to use and it has been nothing but great surprises with this little camera. I love it.

Reviews.Title: great refurb
Reviews.Author: suzyQ
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, recently used it on a river rafting trip & it took a beating but still works like new.

Reviews.Title: Love it and I'm a pro.
Reviews.Author: Ron B.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a replacement for my GoPro. This camera does it all and better. Take a close look at what it can do.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: Takes decent photos and is great for the beach and other outdoor occasions. I tested it out in the sink and have been using it instead of my other camera to get used to it.  I like it a lot.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money - would recommend
Reviews.Author: HoustonTX
Reviews.Content: I am by no means an expert, but do have several higher-end cameras (including an older Nikonos 35mm underwater camera used for diving).I bought this camera as a low-price option to take on vacation that the kids could use in the pool and at the beach and also could be used for snapping quick pics at dinner as well.  I was a little leery as some of the reviews were negative on picture quality.  Consumer Reports also gave it a lower rating, but I decided to give it a shot anyway.Overall, I'm happy with the purchase - the picture quality was pretty good and definitely good for the price of the camera.  It worked well for us in all situations (on land and in the water) and is easy to use.  It has some interesting features and filters that were fun to play with.I would recommend purchasing a floating strap to keep from losing the camera (I didn't lose it, but came close on one occasion).

Reviews.Title: Good Camera but WAY overpriced on Amazon
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this camera in and out for about 5 days, wanted something we could take on our cruise that would take a beating while being waterproof and this one fit the bill, I will say there are a ton of features on this camera that will take some getting used to. One thing I want to point out is the price has increased on Amazon over the last month, in Jan of this year it was $124, now its $50 more (prob has to due with spring time), anyway we searched and found it at our local walmart April 1st for $126 plus tax. These are cheaper on ebay too BUT you will NOT get a manufacturers warranty if you buy on ebay so keep that in mind, you have to buy from a FujiFilm authorized retailer (like amazon and walmart are). Only reason for 4 starts is due to Amazons high/increased price.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Steven S. Abadi
Reviews.Content: bought this camera used for a coworkers birthday that wanted a waterproof camera and she was very satisfied with the quality and durability of this camera!

Reviews.Title: The BANG for you BUCK$
Reviews.Author: Jose varela
Reviews.Content: Simply Amazing!! Couldn't of asked for a better camera for that price. WELL worth it went snorkeling with it battery last very long.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely wonderful underwater camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Takes awesome underwater photos and  underwater panoramic photos!!! Brought it on our caribbean cruise and captured great pictures! Would highly recommend this camera for anyone!

Reviews.Title: Victor O
Reviews.Author: Victor Olivera
Reviews.Content: Is what i was looking for and more!Is great!!!The pics are fantastic and the films are so good!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Cole
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to go on a cruise and we had a lot of water activities planned. It was great, took good pictures and movies in and out of the water.  The screen was easy to see what you were shooting at. One thing I didn't like is its to easy to cover the lens when your holding the camer because it's in the coner of the camera.  It would also be nice if it came with a float strap since it's a water camera.  I would recommend buying this camera, for the price it's a good little camera.I was unhappy with the shipping time. I paid extra for expedited shipping and it took 5 business days to receive it. It came the day before we left, so it left very little time to get acquainted with how the camera worked.

Reviews.Title: Pretty great
Reviews.Author: Angela Johnson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it was waterproof, high megapixels at a reasonable price with decent reviews. Over all i like the camera. Its nice looking, easy to work, has some great features, etc. it doesnt take as high quality pictures as i would like. U have to use a tripod to get actually great pictures to avoid any bit of blurriness. I was also not impressed with the macro feature either. As a nature photographer i take a lot of close up pictures and wanted a compact camera that could take great photos. All in all for the price, u really cant do much better though. I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: FujiFilm FinePix waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: ANDREA JORDAN
Reviews.Content: I took this camera to the Bahamas. Although i did not get the opportunity to take underwater pictures, the other photos turned out amazing.  My new go to travel camera

Reviews.Title: like camera, vendor not cooperative
Reviews.Author: Just Dan
Reviews.Content: I like the camera, does what I expected.Accidentally order went through twice. Received camera from vender just in time to leave for vacation, so was unable to request return of second camera. Now over 30 days vender refuses to accept the return of the UNOPENED, unused duplicate camera. I will be sure NEVER to order if KNOCKOUT DEALS is the vender.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic crisp pictures!
Reviews.Author: Francette Trasybule
Reviews.Content: Went on a trip to Costa Rica and we were afraid to put the camera under the water, but the pictures came out great! We did snorkeling and took pictures of fish underwater. Bright and clear with no damage to camera or pictures. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Michael W Sefton
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this camera. I am anxious to try it under water. It arrived sooner than I expected and the price was good.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality!
Reviews.Author: Doug Rowand
Reviews.Content: We took a sailing trip where this camera was constantly in a wet swimsuit or pounding surf and it held up beautifully, and more importantly took great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Mrs.Reiter
