Reviews.Content: Got this camera for our honeymoon in hawaii. I have zero photography experience. The pics we took all came out fabulous! Took lots of underwater as well as above water shots all were awesome! Great easy camera to use.

Reviews.Title: amazing!
Reviews.Author: kathleen dalton
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera ever! I got amazing underwater pics and videos! It also works amazing out of water! Highly recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Julio
Reviews.Content: Great camera and awesome to use in the water just like advertised. Would defenately purchase another one in the future.

Reviews.Title: Had a dead pixel in it.  Also, no paper work was in the box.
Reviews.Author: Old Time Rock Lover
Reviews.Content: The basic design of this is fine.  The unit had a dead pixel in the lower middle of the sensor.  No paperwork was in the box upon delivery, so that did not facilitate return.  Time is valuable, wasting time on stuff like this is not.  If Amazon reads this and wants to get me my paperwork, fine.  I don't even know how to "take care" of something like this, but from what I gather if it is not sold directly by Amazon, you won't necessarily get satisfactory return service from the seller, and as for shipping it back to China, good luck.

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong in or out of water
Reviews.Author: jay
Reviews.Content: Great Camera pictures are excellent battery lasted 3 days we even had thrown it of the cliffs to each other to get picture of cliff jumping no major impact but more than a standard camera could take inside stayed dry under water

Reviews.Title: Excellent, Works as Designed
Reviews.Author: stuffintn
Reviews.Content: takes excellent pictures in water or out, took to Florida and was able to use in ocean and pool, worked great

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Carol12345
Reviews.Content: Works well.  I like the features (works in lots of light settings, can take panoramic, etc.).  Haven't tried to use it underwater yet.  I'll update review after I've tried it.

Reviews.Title: Cool camera
Reviews.Author: Corrinne Babbitt
Reviews.Content: Like the underwater capability and ruggedness. Wish it focused better and took faster pics (I have it on the fastest speed and its still slower than my cheapo camera). Doesnt zoom as far as my cheapo either, which made me sad. But good pixels, good size (fits in my pocket), nice settings, cool colors and good for people with toddlers who like to take pics on their own too (my 2 year old loves it).

Reviews.Title: Waterproof on a boat is a good thing
Reviews.Author: Sam A. Molletti "Captain Sam"
Reviews.Content: My last camera, also a Fugi, did not survive a dunk in the bilge.  This camera has the same operating system but is waterproof, so far..

Reviews.Title: Good, strong camera!
Reviews.Author: Lindsey
Reviews.Content: This camera is truely eveyrthing proof like it advertises but some of the pictures are a little blurry at times.

Reviews.Title: Gotta Love Fuji, just not the Fuji XP60
Reviews.Author: Pilotjay
Reviews.Content: I'm happy to have a Fuji again. IMO Fastest camera from "ON" to shooting. I used to have the Fuji F700 and missed it greatly. It finally failed and I switched to Nikon. The Nikon L120 takes about 5 seconds "ON" to shooting and is bulky. This Fuji XP60 is fast, takes good photos, light, small, waterproof, dustproof, shock resistant...perfect for an active person. I can carry this everywhere I go easily! The only feature this camera is missing is full manual control, shutter speed longer than four seconds, so time exposures are not possible.UPDATE: Photos taken from distance lack any detail. The picture quality is substandard and I am very disappointed with this camera. I'm going to try the Fuji F660EXR. I love Fuji's speed, but I require quality photography. I really miss the Fuji F700!

Reviews.Title: My daughter took it to Antigua.
Reviews.Author: Henry Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I got it for her and she loves it, in the water out of the water.  She took a ton of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Fun Camera! Quality Photos!
Reviews.Author: anon "anon"
Reviews.Content: This is going to be a lot of fun this summer. My daughter is anxious to take this to the pool and beach. But we tested it out today by using a plastic container filled with water and some sea shells and sea glass. It felt strange at first, purposely putting a camera in water. I kept feeling like I was going to ruin it, but of course, it is waterproof so it was fine. I posted some of the photos here, up above at the top of this amazon page.We took the pics in our carport, so it was shady, but still they came out pretty good. I have not edited these at all, but it would be easy to brighten them a little using Picasa (free download from the internet) or whatever photo editing program you like to use. For one picture I held the lense halfway above the water and halfway under the water. I went in and added a small red mark so you can see where the water line is. That might be a fun angle to use in some of the water pics this summer. The rest were taken with the camera completely submerged. We used the water setting (and there is even a macro/small-detail water setting, but we didn't need that). I am really happy with the way they came out. I was worried an underwater camera would show a lot of distortion and blur, but happily that was not the case.I also posted one picture of my chicken so you can see what regular, non-water photos come out like. My daughter took this one and said she just had it on the auto setting. I love how close up you can get yet it's still so clear and clean.My family and I are going to get a lot of use out of this camera!edit 8/3/2013: I took my daughter and her friend to the pool this weekend and we brought the camera. They had a blast! They took pics, but also made videos of each other jumping in, and swimming underwater. It was really neat to come home and look at the pictures and watch underwater videos. This is a lot of fun. If you like the pool or beach, this is a great camera for you. My favorite video was my daughter swimming in circles underwater around her friend, then popping up and seeing her friend above water. It reminded me of a shark's point of view, in a goofy way. Just one more way to perserve summer memories. :)

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy This From Amazon
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I bought this a few months back and only got to use it once before it just stopped working for no apparent reason. It was too late to return it back to amazon.com, and it is covered under one year warranty by Fujifilm but, as I just found out, you need a camera serial number on your receipt (for proof of purchase for that certain camera for the warranty) and amazon.com does NOT keep track of serial numbers of consumer electronics they sell. So I am s*** out of luck. I even brought it to a local photo store and they said it does not look water damaged and there are no dents, so it is an electronics issue that would (hopefully) be fixed under warranty IF amazon.com would have kept track of serial numbers. I don't have any complaints about Fujifilm or this camera, because events like this do happen with electronics, but I will NEVER buy anything that could be under warranty from amazon.com EVER again. I am not going to risk this chance and waste another $150.

Reviews.Title: Outrageously Good
Reviews.Author: Mark King
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it shoots amazing photos and videos. I bought it to take diving in Jamaica, but I had it for two months before the trip. I fell in love with the compact size, easy operation and the fact that it's sealed against rain, dirt and dust. I took a lot of photos with it before I took it diving and I was worried that maybe it would not be water proof.Finally the day came, we went diving, the pictures and videos turned out amazing. We used the camera down to 12 foot depths and never had  a problem. Everyone who has seen the pictures is amazed that we did them with a $130 camera. A 32GB SD Card had plenty of capacity for a whole week of photos and videos in Jamaica. We're very happy with the camera.Several people who saw us using it asked what it was, I was glad to tell them how happy I am with it.I really think that if someone has a problem with water getting in they did not have the door closed correctly. It could be easy to get the wrist string in the gasket and deform it, then you're going to have problems. I was very careful every time I opened and closed my camera and I had zero problems.We may get another one just so we have a back up, we really liked it a lot.

Reviews.Title: if you don't have a waterproof, you need to get one
Reviews.Author: Elle
Reviews.Content: finally a waterproof that functions as well as your typical portable camera. something that your typical portable camera does not have is a record button instead of a record-setting. a single button push start your videos from the shooting mode. by the end of my trip I was not even using my Sony Cybershot anymore.

Reviews.Title: Works Fine In Pool
Reviews.Author: Phyllis T. Smith
Reviews.Content: II'm not a particularly sophisticated photographer--this is only the second camera I've had in the last ten years.  I wanted something rugged that would be simple to operate.  Also was fascinated with the idea of taking pictures underwater in the pool. This is easy to use and yes, it works fine under water. I got some nice shots of friends swimming and look forward to using this a lot this summer.  Nothing to criticize because so far I am completely satisfied.  I particularly liked how easy it was for a relatively inexperienced photographer like me to learn to use.

Reviews.Title: Fantastically nice little camera for the intended use.
Reviews.Author: Narut Ujnat "Enthusiasm is contagious."
Reviews.Content: As I am sure many people have experienced the wish that the nice little digital camera could be practically used in environments that no one would have anticipated years ago.  I do sure remember using film cameras that were disposable at the beach and during snorkeling trips.This camera is digital, and is able to be used in places we just might talk about at a fancy party.1.  What's in the box?:  You receive the camera (I received the blue version), a battery, a cord, a charger (with USB cord), and a instruction book with a CD manual.2.  Aesthetic:?  First off, the camera is a nice small size that is about the size of a palm for a larger person, or a entire hand for a child: the camera is not large.  The camera coated with some rubber like matierial on the sides and the back.  The lens is on the top right (facing you on the front), with various buttons on the top (including power) and a nice display with the expected buttons on the back next to the display.  On one side, there is a big button that rotates to securely hide the brains of the unit (picture card, etc).3.  Use:?  I am familiar with Fujifilm based on another excellent camera I tried some months ago.  I will say that this camera is not in the same universe as far as function.  That is, this camera is for taking pictures in a demanding environment and so film images are not going to be as high quality.  There is no practical zoom on the camera itself as the lens does not move.  You do get 5X zoom, but that is very limiting.  The power up is extremely quick on this camera, which is excellent.  there is also a appreciated 'burst' function that allows for quick  numbers of pictures during an action sequence, for example.  The functions are almost standard today in terms of the ability to display pictures, turn flash on and off and the like.  There are some neat features you can use for stringing together videos, plus functions for different locations which is a very nice feature.The pictures themselves are very nice with the 16MP camera.  For simple point and shoot, the camera takes nice pictures, and I wouldn't complain about quality for simple shots with little composition (in other words quick pictures at the beach, hiking , etc.)  As there is no real zoom, distance shots are not excellent and should not be expected.  Most of the shots should be close-in and not yards away for the best results.  The flash is not overwhelming, so night shots in lower lighting will not be excellent, but serviceable.  (Again, form over function is some cases with this camera).Waterproof?:  I have not tested this camera underwater - yet.  But, I have placed the camera underwater in a sink, and in the shower and the camera has not died.  In fact, the brains (the card port, USB port for charging, and the mini-HDMI for display) are under one opening door. This door has a clever button to push down to open and must be turned to open or close.  You hear a nice click when the door is secured. Also, if you examine the parts, you see a nice silicon seal that has a nice metal fork with puts pressure to seal the camera off from water.  Of course, water pressure will also help to seal off the camera.  It seems secure, and it is difficult for this to be opened accidentally.In short, I am impressed with this camera for what it is.  It will survive water and other bad actors and allow you to take some nice pictures (with the proviso above) as well as video for those trips during which taking your phone is just not the smart thing to do.I will update the review as I continue to mess with more functions of the camera and use it in more demanding circumstances.

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: Michelle Sachtjen
Reviews.Content: I love that it's water and drop proof! Fun pool pictures without freaking that the kids are splashing near my camera! I do wish it had more zoom. Glad I didn't sell my other camera. I will still use it when I need more zoom.

Reviews.Title: Does Not Impress Me a Bit!
Reviews.Author: Tech Weenie "T. Weenie"
Reviews.Content: I own this camera but bought it elsewhere. I figured at 16 megapixels it would produce some pretty outstanding images but it doesn't. My iPhone 5 absolutely blows this thing away on image quality. About all I can give it credit for is being water-resistant. Images are noisy at any ISO and the autofocus sucks. It will not isolate and selectively focus on a closer subject even when set to center focus and macro settings. A real loser in my book!

Reviews.Title: Great delivery
Reviews.Author: Icarus "Icarus"
Reviews.Content: Going on a cruise next month and wanted something durable. I've taken a couple of pictures so far, but nothing wet or wild yet.This item was delivered extremely quickly! Ordered on Sunday and bit was in my mailbox on Tuesday. Haven't had any issues to even need customer service but if it's anything like the delivery service I'm sure I'll be happy.  I did also purchase the wrist band and data card that were recommended for it.

Reviews.Title: Great beginner camera
Reviews.Author: Psychdrk
Reviews.Content: Got this for a 10-year-old boy to make videos and take photos. It has great durability and takes fantastic photos for him!

Reviews.Title: battery completely dead after 9 months (only a couple of usages)...
Reviews.Author: suxiang gong
Reviews.Content: I feel obiligated to write this review and let people be aware...We planned for months a snorkeling trip to Cancun and we found out the night before our flight that the battery is dead and cannot be charged.  It worked well with the AC connected so we didn't notice.  We had to buy a couple of disposable cameras in Mexico so that we won't completely miss the moments in our snorkeling trip.  I was furious as we bought the camera about 9 months ago and used it only a couple of times! It is totally a design defect.  User be aware:  If you are planning to take the camera to an important event, buy something more reliable.  We are very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: vic
Reviews.Content: just finished a trip to the philippines and it works great. im just a causual user...great in the ocean and pool.

Reviews.Title: I HATE THIS PIECE OF CRAP.  And their customer service is USELESS AND INCOMPETENT
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: This stupid camera is the worst piece of crap ever.  I bought one in August and it's made two trips back to the manufacturer.  It's currently there right now because (two weeks after receiving it) their useless customer service team of 3 guys can't get their act together and do work.  It's insane; the manager promised me rush delivery on my exchange as soon as he got it.  Now, they just keep hanging up and putting me on hold without doing anything.  I paid $200 to never be able to use my camera.The reason it went to the shop?  The focus stopped working.  Also, even though it's waterproof, there was saltwater damage to the battery compartment.  Ridiculous.  Then, the replacement they sent me had the EXACT SAME PROBLEM.  It is truly a cheap, worthless camera.  Spend the extra $30 and get a Samsung.

Reviews.Title: One sweet camera
Reviews.Author: Colorado Hermit "ColoradoHermit"
Reviews.Content: I have a couple other digital camera's, a Canon PowerShot S3 IS and a old Kodak EasyShare. This one is just as easy to use as the simple Kodak but takes great photo's as nice as the Canon PowerShot S3. It's one nice Point-n-shoot camera. I haven't had a chance to try it under water yet though. That will come later this summer when I make a trip down south to southern Oklahoma to see my old friends and get some Bass fishing in. I highly recommend this camera for anybody that doesn't like the over complicated ones and cant get a steady picture out of the smaller point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Thrilled to have this camera
Reviews.Author: Duane Sparks "Duane"
Reviews.Content: Upon receiving the camera today, I immediately opened the box to try it and see what it was like.  I've never owned a waterproof camera and we are going to the Florida Keys for snorkeling.  I am SO anxious to see how good (or bad) the photos taken underwater will be.  I like the idea of the complete manual being in the camera.  I haven't taken enough photos yet to test the battery life, but it charges quickly and the charging plug makes it easy to use.  It is a little small for my large hands and the buttons feel a bit tiny, but they have a nice firm touch to them.  I tried with my diving gloves on and there was sufficient feel to make me confident I could operate it underwater.I took outdoor photos in bright sun, both closeups and using the optical zoom.  All photos were simply excellent.  There was the slightest bit of blurring in the zoom photos when set at the greatest distance from camera shake.It was quick to warm up when first turned on, and took very little time between snaps.I am still skeptical of anything underwater ( I never wear my waterproof watch in the shower), but I am tempted to fill our bathtub to the top and try this out.  I won't do that...but the idea is there.I highly recommend this camera based on one day's usage.  If that changes, I will modify my review.

Reviews.Title: trash
Reviews.Author: turtle man
Reviews.Content: bought on sunday took out in boat monday, never used underwater at most misted from sea spray, did not even last till the end of the boat trip, i think i might have set a record for fastest broken camera

Reviews.Title: Package was torn,, Obviously NOT NEW
Reviews.Author: arock
Reviews.Content: Obviously not a new item even though advertised as new. The packaging had a huge rip in it. The whole bottom right corner is torn off. Nothing inside is sealed. This was intended to be a gift. Now what am I supposed to do??

Reviews.Title: Poor and Inconsistent picture quality
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: Some pictures are in focus but far too many of them are not despite have the camera focus on the subject.White balance is usually off also.I compared this to my Olympus TG-1 and there is no comparison. The Olympus is much better albeit more expensive.

ProductInfo.Features:
Waterproof to 20 ft., Shockproof to 5 ft., Freeze proof to 14°F and Dust/Sand proof
2.7-inch TFT color LCD monitor
16.4 million effective pixels 1/2.3-inch CMOS image sensor with primary color filter and Optical Image Stabilizer
Fujinon 5x optical zoom lens with approx. 2x digital zoom (up to approx. 10x, with 5x optical zoom)
Full HD movie recording (1920 x 1080p) with a dedicated Movie Recording Button and Burst Mode Button
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix XP60 16.4MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue)
